Hace 6 años que ha puesto su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: pan, manteca, jabón, arroz, azúcar, café, sal, pastas, churros, dulces, refrescos, frijoles y otros. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos de la canasta básica como azúcar, arroz, manteca, pan, refrescos, churros, harina, huevos, jabón y otros para surtir el negocio y continuar obteniendo mejores ventas y ganancias, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. El piensa comprar un vehículo de trabajo en un futuro y ofrecer otras líneas de productos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos is 41 years old and single. He has one son and lives in the city of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. 

For six years, he's had his own business, a grocery store where he sells basic family goods and products, such as bread, butter, soap, rice, sugar, coffee, salt, pastas, churros, sweets, soft drinks, beans and others. 

He's decided to seek a loan of 10,000 Honduran lempiras to buy more basic goods, such as sugar, rice, butter, bread, soft drinks, churros, flour, eggs, soap and others. These are to stock his business and continue earning better sales and income, as this is his only source of income. 

He's thinking about buying a work vehicle in the future and offering other lines of products in his business.

loans.use: to buy more basic goods, such as sugar, rice, butter, bread, soft drinks, churros, flour, eggs, soap and others to stock his business.

loans.name: Goreti's Group

texts.en:
Goreti's Group is comprised of two hard-working women. Goreti is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mbale, in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Goreti has been working hard to manage her clothes business in which she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Goreti has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more new, fashionable clothes to sell and will help Goreti to generate greater profits and educate her children in better schools. 

Goreti hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a cow and a plot of land. 

Goreti is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more new, fashionable clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 49 años, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, tiene una familia unida, vive en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Lagunas; goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Oscar es la venta de productos mediciales como, uña de gato, agracejo, chaca piedra, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia aproximadamente, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercaderia para aumentar mayor cantidad del producto, aumentando el stock que ya tiene y poder atender a un mayor número de clientes, lo que le generara mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende mejorará us calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Oscar is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children. They are a close-knit family. They live in a large community in the urban area of Lagunas located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. The locals make their living in farming, livestock and commerce. Oscar sells medicinal products such as cat's claw, barberries and chaca stone, and he has approximately ten years of experience. He has good personal and work references from his neighbors. He is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,500 nuevos soles in order to buy merchandise to build his inventory, since he has to attend to a larger number of customers. This will generate more income and better profits, which will ultimately lead to a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase products at wholesale for later resale.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Janeth, a 38-year-old farmer from Litein, Kenya. A mother of two,  she is very passionate about farming. She started doing dairy farming nine years ago. Since then, she has never looked back - she loves it. Her main sources of income are milk and tea. Milking her own cows is an activity she finds to be most enjoyable. She is appreciative of the fact that milk prices in the region sustain dairy farmers. This enables her to enjoy profits from selling milk which is part of the reason she is seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. An additional cow will certainly boost milk production in her farm. This will translate to more sales volume and better income for her and her family.  

Janeth believes the key to increased milk production is proper health of the animal. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein in her diet to be healthy. By ensuring her cows are healthy, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. The additional income she will make will go towards affording her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos de 21 y 19 años a su cargo, su casa es propia de material rustico ubicada en Mz. T 001 sector Pueblo Libre - Lagunas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería y pesca, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado caprino y ovino como chivos ovejas y también se dedica a la agricultura sembrando maiz, tiene muchos años de experiencia en estas actividades, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en arreglar su casa, para darle mayor seguridad y comodidad a su familia, mejorando la calidad de vidad de todos ellos.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 49 years old and lives with her spouse.  They have two children, ages 21 and 19.  The house that they own is made of rustic materials, and it is located in the Pueblo Libre sector of Lagunas.  The people of this community work in agriculture, business, livestock and fishing.  The community is located in the Chiclayo province, which is in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

She works raising goats and sheep, as well as growing corn.  She has many years of experience in this field.  She has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in repairing her home so that she can give her family greater security and comfort, improving their quality of life.

loans.use: repair her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a large pot and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking 24-year-old farmer from Kabartegan Village in Litein, Kenya. She is a committed wife and a mother to three boys. She has been doing mixed farming for the last five years and her main income sources are milk, eggs and crops. She is also engaged in other personal businesses. Janet enjoys dairy farming, milking of cows particularly. She is contented with the farming way of life. Her ambition is to generate more income and take better care of the people who she looks after. Her main challenge is ensuring the proper health status of her animals. She says this takes a lot of commitment and attendance. 

Janet is requesting a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. Dairy cows, over the years, have provided her a means to be self-sufficient. Now, with your loan, Janet will get more dairy products from her cows that will bring her extra income to keep up with her rising family expenses. She acknowledges that keeping a dairy cow is a big commitment that needs careful preparation but she knows she is up for the task and she is going to do it big.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase broken down refrigerators and coolers to fix them and resell them at reasonable prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap, and cigarettes to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 6 hijos pero solo dos tiene a su cargo, ella vive en el municipio de Nueva frontera, Santa Bárbara. Hace varios años que ella tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar. Vende manteca, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, embutidos, carne de pollo, maíz, productos enlatados, churros, pastillas, etc. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamo que es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir más el negocio y aumentar su clientela. Comprara carne de pollo, embutidos, maiz, golosinas, refrescos, arroz, frijoles, manteca y otros abarrotes. Ella tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio y poder mejorar las condiciones de su familia y de su vivienda.
texts.en: Sonia is 34 and lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara with her common-law husband, but only two of the children are under their care. For several years she has had her own grocery store. She sells items such as butter, sugar, rice, beans, sausages, chicken, corn, dairy products, pastries and churros. She is seeking her third loan, which is in the amount of 15,000 lempiras. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase chicken, sausage, corn, beans, rice, butter and other groceries. Her goal is to grow her business and thus be able to improve conditions for her family and in her home.

loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise such as chicken, sausage, corn, beans, rice, butter, candy and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 30-year-old hardworking single man who has been running a cosmetics and beauty shop for two years, earning an income of KES 20,000 at the end of every month.
  
Samuel was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He will use the entire amount to buy hair chemicals, body lotions, creams and perfumes which are quite in demand. Samuel plans to use the anticipated income to open another cosmetics and beauty shop in a nearby town. 

He hopes to become a wholesaler of cosmetics and beauty products in his community.

loans.use: to buy body lotions, body creams, hair chemicals and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 52 years. He is married and, together with his wife, they have been blessed with four children. His wife provides additional income. 

Paul is a farmer who sells cattle and he has done this business for the last 15 years. 

He has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kes 20,000, which he will use to buy cattle for farming. He will plow the anticipated profit back into his business. 

His hope and dream for the future is to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 43 years old. She is single but blessed with three children; one in college and two in secondary school.

Serah is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,500. She has requested her third loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 50,000 which she will use to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting. Serah successfully repaid her previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Serah will be able to expand her business into car washing. She will be able to buy a car wash machine. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to own a piece of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Recheal is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. One of them is currently in school. For the past year, Recheal has been working hard to manage her charcoal business. 

Recheal is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and take care of her family. Recheal hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Recheal is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Fatuma owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has been operating a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal sellers.
 
With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase three sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Meet Cornelius, a 33-year-old hardworking farmer, who hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya (an area always referred to as “the city of champions”, because it is home to the best long distance runners in the world, many having won gold medals in international events). He has a wife and two lovely children that he really treasures and values and will always do anything possible to protect. He practices mixed farming, i.e. crop and animal farming, and he has been doing this for the past six years. He passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed his cow “Lelmet” and whenever he is milking his cow he feels very proud.

Eldoret area is the fourth largest town in Kenya and is very populated. Cornelius sells milk and farm produce at the market and has been earning a decent income, but one challenge he has been facing is transporting the products from his rural village to the market. Cornelius comes from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, that are not tarmacked, hence timely delivery of his products to the market is affected. Sometimes he sells his products at a throwaway price because it is not fresh. Cornelius sells milk, vegetables and fruits: perishable products that need timely delivery to the market in order to fetch a high price.

Through the loan Cornelius will be able to purchase a motorbike,  which he will use for the timely delivery of his products and this will translate into more profits.  Consequently, he will never suffer losses because of not delivering products on time to the market. With the help and goodwill of  lenders,  he is going to achieve his goal, and profits from the business will be used in fully repaying  the loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his business

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.en: Appolinaire is 35 years old. He is married with four children. He sells rice, cooking oil and wants to use the loan to buy more rice and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business for better results.

loans.use: to buy more rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jessenia Patricia

texts.es:
La venta de hielo y helados, fueron el sustento de Jessenia durante muchos años. Soporte que nunca dejó de desaprovechar porque lo tuvo como visión para poder llegar a convertirse en la microempresaria que es actualmente, mediante ahorros y préstamos en otras instituciones. Ahora esta mujer de 37 años, está orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, con el gran esfuerzo a pesar de haber llegado hasta primer año de secundaria, debido a problemas económicos. Ya tiene dos años y medio de tener su pulpería, convirtiéndose en una de las más gustadas de su barrio.
Jessenia es madre de dos hijos de 13 y 5 años de edad, de quienes está a cargo junto con el apoyo económico y moral de su esposo, quien trabaja en el Ministerio de salud, como guarda de seguridad. Su sueño es llegar a tener una pulpería más grande, pero para eso necesita de un préstamo para comprar arroz, jabón, aceite, frijoles y azúcar, productos que diariamente piden los clientes y que ayudarán a incrementar sus ventas e ingresos, para poder invertir en su negocio más adelante. Entre sus planes está mejorar su casa, para garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
For many years, selling ice and ice cream were Jessenia's livelihood.  She never ceased to take advantage of savings and loans through other institutions because she knew it was the way for her to become the small business owner that she is now.  Now, this 37-year-old woman is proud of having her own business through a lot of effort despite only having reached the first year of high school given financial problems.  She has now had her convenience store for two and a half years, and it is one of the most liked stores in the neighborhood.  

Jessenia is a mother of two children who are 13 and 5 years old.  She takes care of them along with her husband and his moral and financial support.  Her husband works for the ministry of health as a security guard.  Her dream is to have a larger store, but for this, she needs a loan to purchase rice, soap, oil, beans and sugar.  These are products that are requested daily by her customers, and they will help increase her sales and earnings so that she can incest in her business in the future.  Among her plans are repairing her home so that she can guarantee a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Purchase rice, soap, oil, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Filadelfo De Jesus

texts.es:
Filadelfo toda su vida se ha dedicado al negocio de reparación de electrométrico con un especial énfasis en máquinas de coser actividad que aprendió Empíricamente.

Filadelfo presenta varios problemas para reparar los electrodomésticos y es que le falta herramienta de mano, como destornilladores y alicates especiales para maquinaria pequeña, también un soldador de mano por tal razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de estos objetos.

El crédito será muy importante para filadelfo pues tendrá la herramienta necesaria para seguir operando y aún más sabiendo que este es el negocio que lo ha mantenido a él y a su familia pro tantos años y es muy feliz haciéndolo lo que más lo motiva con este préstamo es que podrá abrir un local de reparación de todo tipo de electrodoméstico pues tendrá ala herramienta para operar lo que lo tiene lleno de entusiasmo y felicidad.
texts.en:
Filadelfo has worked in appliance repair his whole life, with an emphasis in sewing machines.  He learned this trade on the job.  Filadelfo is facing many problems with repairing the appliances, the main one is a lack of tools such as screwdrivers, special pliers for small machinery, and a handheld soldering iron.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan to purchase these items.

The loan will be very important for Filadelfo because he will have the necessary tools to continue operating since knowing that this business has maintained him and his family for so many years makes him very happy.  What motivates him the most with this loan is that he will be able to open a repair shop for all types of household appliances since he will have the necessary tools, which makes him very happy and enthusiastic.

loans.use: purchase handheld tools such as screwdrivers, pliers and a handheld soldering iron.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary una mujer la cual el mundo le cerró las puertas pues estuvo buscando un empleo por mucho tiempo y nada que podía conseguirlo desde ese entonces comenzó a ofertar sus servicios de manicura y pedicura, actividad que aprendió gracias a un curso gratuito que realizo. 

Muy motivada e ilusionada llega a solicitar un crédito y ante toda agradecía con la corporación pro darle una mano para ser independiente y esperando el apoyo de todos los prestamistas para sacar adelante a su familia y padres.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de un mueble para realizar los cortes, una vitrina para exhibir productos, surtido de productos de belleza y una mesa de manicura y pedicura.

Su sueño es crecer, tener una empresa sostenible en el tiempo y apoyar a su padres incondicionalmente.
texts.en:
Mary is a woman who came up against many closed doors.  She sought full-time employment for a long time, and nothing materialized.  She then began offering manicures and pedicures, which she learned to do thanks to a free course that she took.

Very motivated and hopeful, she is seeking a loan, and she is grateful to the institution for giving her a hand to achieve independence.  She hopes for the support of all of the lenders so that she can provide a better life for her family and her parents.

She will use the loan to purchase beauty products, a table for performing manicures and pedicures, and a display case for her products.

Her dream is to grow and have a sustainable business, and to be able in time to support her parents unconditionally.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, a table for performing manicures and pedicures, and a display case for her products.

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es: José, tiene 53 años, está casado, tiene 6 hijos, vive con su familia en el municipio de Zacapa, Comayagua. El se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijol, este negocio lo tiene hace 15 años y es su fuente de ingresos.  La producción  la vende en la misma zona. El monto del préstamo que solicita es de 10,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la preparación de tierra para la siembra de granos básicos, y compra de fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento al cultivo actual de maíz, esto le ayudara para asistir mejor el cultivo y obtener mayor producción. Su objetivo es darles educación, alimentación y mejor vida a sus hijos y su familia.
texts.en: José is 53 years old, married and has six children.  He lives with his family in the city of Zacapa, Comayagua.  He works growing basic grains such as corn and beans.  He has had this business for 15 years and it is his source of income.  He sells his harvests in the same region.  He is seeking a loan for 10,000 lempiras that he will invest in getting his land ready to plant basic grains and to purchase fertilizers to care for his corn crops.  This will help him to better care for his crops and yield a better harvest.  His goal is to provide his children and family with education, food and a better life.

loans.use: prepare his land to plant basic grains and purchase fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and butter

loans.name: Husen

texts.en:
Husen is repeat client of IMON. He is married with two children. Husen is a responsible person who lives with his family in a rural area. For the past 10 years, he has been busy with his taxi business. Husen has great experience in this field and has regular clients that help him improve his living conditions little by little.

Husen is requesting a 3,800 TJS loan to buy medicines. His wife is ill and he does not have money. Husen awaits your support and generosity.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his wife's treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for his mother.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage a clothing business, which sells clothes.

To help expand the business, Nuru has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more new types of clothes to sell, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Nuru hopes that in the future she will be able to open a bigger wholesale boutique.

Nuru is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more new types of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jessica Lisette

texts.es:
Jessica de 33 años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos menores de edad, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Esta joven mujer  de caracteriza por ser luchadora con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudito y se vieron obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos.  En la vida tiene muchas aspiraciones y sueños como formar a sus hijos, y tener un lugar propio donde vivir por tales razones se dedica a  trabajar arduamente y mantener su negocio actividad que la disfruta mucho porque ha sido  la forma de vida de su familia.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa de adultos y niños como: pantalones, camisas, camisetas, shores, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior. Ella  tiene por rutina de trabajo unas diez horas ofreciendo sus productos de forma ambulante y por encargo a clientes fijos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa, para que un  futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jessica agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jessica is 33 years old and is a single mother of 3 children. She is a native of Leon, which is located in the western part of the country.

This young woman stands out as a determined person, with a desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, she couldn't finish her schooling and needed to work at a young age to help cover expenses. She has many goals and dreams in life, including to raise her children well and have her own place to live. Therefore she dedicates herself to hard work and maintaining her business, which she enjoys a lot since it makes up a part of her family life.

Thanks to her efforts and her drive to succeed, she supports herself by selling adults' and children's clothing, such as pants, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses, and undergarments. She usually works 10 hours a day as a traveling salesperson and selling to regular customers.

Her goal is to use this loan as capital for her business, expanding her stock of clothing, so that in the near future she can make a higher income. Jessica is grateful for Kiva investors' help, as they provide people with little resources and poor countries like Nicaragua with a path to respectable employment.

loans.use: to stock her business with children's and adults' clothing, such as shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, and t-shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bracelets, watches, necklaces, handbags, and wallets

loans.name: Aysama

texts.en:
Aysama is a 29-year-old married woman. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She is a farmer and is raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has six years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Aysama usually sells her crops in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families, and also make fresh punch. 

Aysama's monthly income is 160 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for a woman, and that is why her spouse helps her. She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of the products she raises and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose, she applied for 500 AZN. This is going to be her third loan, and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to invest in seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Midamini's Group

texts.en:
Midamini's group is comprised of four hard-working women. Midamini is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past three years, Midamini has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells essential goods, such as rice, sugar, beans and soda.

To help expand her business, Midamini has requested a loan in the amount of 950,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase more essential goods for sale, and should help Midamini generate greater profits and thereby improve her family's living standards. Midamini hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a house of her own.

Midamini is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional goods for re-sale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

To earn a living, Saumu operates a fruit- and vegetable-stall business. She sells her fruit and vegetables from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high costs of transportation in her place of operation. Saumu dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 35,000 KES to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for re-sale purposes. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans and to thereby boost her business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables (e.g., sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, etc.) for re-sale

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila está feliz de ver finalizado su última siembra. Obtuvo excelentes resultados en esta cosecha, el frijol y el maíz son de calidad. Ella ha logrado sus metas, por lo que se siente agradecida con las personas que le extendieron la mano cuando más lo necesitaba en el préstamo junto con MiCrédito y KIVA. Gracias al préstamo pudo comprar dos quintales de abono y dos quintales de urea para plaga, además que fue de ayuda para pagar a los trabajadores.
Esta mujer con más de 18 años de experiencia, tiene 54 años de edad y está a cargo de tres de sus cuatro hijos. Con el apoyo de su familia, quiere seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo, por lo que ahora necesita de un préstamo para preparar la tierra de la próxima cosecha, con lo que comprará diez litros de refrescante, dos quintales de urea y pagará a los trabajadores. Materiales que le permitirán tener una mejor producción y podrá cumplir con su próximo objetivo de mejorar la buena temporada anterior. Entre sus metas está ahorrar para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Petronila is happy with the results of her last harvest. She saw excellent results in that harvest - the beans and corn were high quality. She has achieved her goals and is thankful to the people who lent her a hand when she needed it most, through the loan through MiCrédito and Kiva. Thanks to the loan, she was able to buy 2 quintals [~200 lbs] of fertilizer and 2 quintals of urea to combat plague, and it also helped pay the workers.

She is 54 years old, with more than 18 years of experience in this field, and she continues to provide for three of her four children. With her family's support, she would like to continue investing in her business, so she would like another loan to prepare the soil for the next harvest. She will buy 10 liters of refreshers and 2 quintals of urea, as well as pay her workers.

These supplies will help her have higher production, and she will be able to fulfill her next goal of improving on her previous good harvest. Also among her goals is to save for home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase 10 liters of refreshers and 2 quintals of urea, and to pay workers

loans.name: Adonis

texts.es: Adonis, tiene 34 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposa e hijos en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira. El se dedica al cultivo de café y granos básicos como su fuente de ingresos. Este negocio lo tiene hace 10 años. La producción de café la vende en grano en la misma zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 25,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar  abono y foliares necesarios para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de café y sacar mejor cosecha. Tiene como meta comprar dos manzanas de terreno para sembrar mas café y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Adonis is 34 years old and married. He has two children and he lives with his wife and children in a small town in the municipality of Gracias Lempira. He cultivates coffee and basic grains as a source of income. He has had this business for 10 years. He sells the coffee beans in the same region. He has applied for a loan of 25,000 lempiras with which is he is going to buy fertilizer and plan food necessary to maintain the coffee crops and have a larger harvest. His goal is to buy 3.44 acres of land to plant more coffee and obtain a larger income.

loans.use: to buy manure and plant food necessary for to maintain coffee crops.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with three school-going children. She lives with her family in their own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a tailoring business. She operates her business from the market, where neighbors and passersby are her customers. She explains that her major business challenge is seasonality.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES to purchase materials (such as cloth and needles) and to repair her broken sewing machine. She thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing materials (e.g., cloth and needles) and repairing her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is married and has been blessed with four school-going children. Her husband is a businessman, and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Sarah operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. Margret dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional goods (e.g., dishes, spoons and used clothes) for re-sale.

loans.name: Shikha Rani

texts.en:
Shikha is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village, Mouyamari in Maynaguri, with her husband and two lovely sons. Her sons attend school and are in grade 8 and grade 10. Both Shikha and her husband, Shishir, have completed secondary education, and they could not get the opportunity for further study because of poor economic resources.

Shikha's husband is a sweetmeat seller. He has a small shop in the local market.  As his income is insufficient for the family's wellbeing, Shikha has been involved in animal husbandry. She has been practicing livestock breeding for last few years, and she has a dairy cow in her herd. She sells milk to the local people for an additional income. Together, they somehow manage the essential needs of the family.

Now Shikha has decided to improve her business to generate more income. She wants to start a milk products business, such as butter, paneer (cottage cheese), curds, etc., and for that, she needs more cows for more milk. The joint initiative with Kiva and BJS enables her to get a loan to purchase a milking cow. Once the cow is purchased, Shikha will start producing dairy products to use for her family as well as to sell locally. This will increase their income, and she will provide better living conditions for her family, along with a better education to her sons.

She is grateful to the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow for her business.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Lenders! The above picture presents to you Evans, a very hardworking man, very ambitious and a go-getter who is 43 years of age and hails from Chuka area of Kenya, a rural town on the slopes of the famous Mount Kenya. He is married and together with his wife they support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 20 years. Through all those years he has been able to take care of his family and pay school fees for his school going children.

Although this humble man has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses" - he has been facing financial challenges and because Chuka area has ready market for cereals he is seeking kindly for a loan to buy cereals and be able to improve his income level.

Evans' upbringing was challenging and he has been facing many economic problems but this ever-smiling man has been making great improvements and he believes that through your loan he will be able to realize his goal of improving his living conditions and transforming his life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo Evans has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances and he hopes that through profits from his business he will fully pay back the loan. Evans is very visionary and hopes through accumulated profits he will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boast his income and completely turn his life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Grupo De Tzamjuyup 1 Group

texts.es:
Pascuala emprendedora y con mucha ambición hacia el futuro de poder llegar a ser alguien diferente en la vida es soltera de 28 años de edad tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad los dos de ellos son buenos estudiantes en la escuela de la comunidad donde residen, sus hijos han sido el motivo por el que ella se ha decidido a emprender un negocio. (La representante del grupo es la que porta el güipil verde)
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de ropas típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de tostadas negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de 2 años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su comunidad.
Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Pascuala para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda súper y tener ingresos importantes.
El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería o ropa típica para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es que sus hijos sean profesionales y agrandar su negocio en su comunidad.
Uno de sus aspiraciones en los próximos años es ver a sus hijos convertirse en mejores profesionales y que ellos tengan ese futuro de éxito en sus campos laborales y en la vida.
texts.en:
Pascuala is very enterprising and ambitious for a future in which she will be able to be somebody else in life.  She is single, 28 years old and has two children, aged 7 and 5 years old. Both of her children are good students at the school in the community where they live. Her children have been the motivation for her decision to start a business. In the photo, Pascuala is the member of the group that is weraring the green blouse.

The work Pascuala does with such care is the buying and selling of traditional clothing.  This work is done at her home and in places close to the community where she lives. A second business that she has is the sale of tostadas (fried corn tortillas).  She has been doing this with her sister for more than two years because it generates an income used for the wellbeing of their family and the improvement of the economic conditions in their community.

Pascuala has been an example within her community. That is why a group of women have joined Pascuala to start their businesses so that each of them can improve and have a significant income. The loan will be used for the purpose of buying merchandise or traditional clothing to be sold in her area. 

One of her aspirations is that her children become professionals and expand her business within her community. One of her hopes for the coming years is to see her children become better professionals and have successful futures in their career fields and in life.

loans.use: investment in the sale of traditional clothing

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en:
Zohrab is 23 years old, and he is single. He has been living with his parents in Gorgan village of the Fuzuli region as an Internally Displaced Person for over 21 years. After military service, Zohrab decided to begin his business. For more than two years, he has been a taxi driver transporting passengers between Baku and Fuzuli. Also, he transports fruits and vegetables from Fuzuli to Baku. 

As shown in the picture, his car is old, and the motor of car was damaged. For repairing the motor, he needs a loan in the amount of 900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Therefore, he has applied to Komak company. In the future, Zohrab wants to change his car, and in his personal life, he wants to get married and have children.

loans.use: to pay for repairing the motor of his car

loans.name: Sarathi

texts.en:
Sarathi hails from Maynaguri. She is an active and energetic entrepreneur. She is married and the mother of two children: one boy and one girl. Both of her children attend school. They all live in a small village, Upenpally, in Jalpaiguri district. Sarathi studied till grade 4.

Sarathi has an animal husbandry business. She started this business a few years back to help the family financially. She rears one dairy cow. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. Sarathi provides the main source of income for her family. Her income is the principle source of income in the family, but her income is not quite sufficient to provide financial sustenance to her children, and it is hardly enough to bear their educational costs.

Sarathi would like to earn even more income for her family and is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a milk cow. She will use the milk products for her family, to cut expenses, and also to sell in the neighborhood. Her goal is to be able to add more cows and expand into a farm. Her main challenge is to provide a higher education to her children, which she hopes to be fulfilled through the profit of her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow in order to increase her milk sales and profit.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married and has been blessed with six school-going children. Her husband is a businessman, and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mishi operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. Mishi dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: paint his house

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
This is Richie. She is 43 years old and currently resides with her family in Cavite, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Richie would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Richie hopes to expand her business and manage a grocery store of her own. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
María una gran luchadora de la vida que hace 9 años inicio con una venta de tamales la cual fue alternando con venta de variedades como barnice, productos de uso personal, chulos, diademas entre otras cosas ya que era madre cabeza de hogar y velaba por el cuidado de sus 2 hijos.

Con la ayuda de los microcréditos ha logrado mejorar y tener un local comercial y ahora pide la ayuda nuevamente para surtir su negocio comprando variedad de mercancía como flotadores, ropa para hombre y dama, zapatos, gorras, billeteras etc. 

Con el préstamo podrá mejorar su negocio y ante todo das las gracias a todas las personas que quieren confiar en ella pues es una prueba viviente que con ánimos y mucho trabajo se puede lograr grandes cosas, no quiere trazarse una meta pues cuando la alcance no tendrá más ilusión prefiere mejorar cada día y esforzarse por sus hijos, por su familia, por ella misma.
texts.en:
Maria is a great fighter in life who 9 years ago began selling tamales. She then started alternating this with the sale of hairspray, personal products, curlers, and hairbands among other things. She is a mother head of household, and she vigilantly cares for her two children.

With the help of micro loans, she has been able to improve and to have a local store. She now asks for help once again to supply her business by purchasing an assortment of merchandise such as armbands, clothing for men and women, shoes, hats, wallets, etc. 

With this loan, she will be able to improve her business. Most importantly, she gives thanks to all of the people that have believed in her, as she is living proof that with courage and hard work great things can be achieved. She does not want to set a goal because once she meets it she will no longer have a motivation. Instead, she prefers to improve day after day and to make an effort for her children, her family, and herself.

loans.use: to buy a assortment of clothes for men and women, wallets, hats, and bags.

loans.name: Presiñano

texts.es:
Presiñano tiene 56 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su propia casa del Caserío de Guayaquil, una zona rural de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como carneros, patos, y gallinas, desde hace 10 años su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales y alimento permitan ofrecer a un mayor precio, generando así mayores ingresos, y por ende mejorando su caldiad de vida.
texts.en:
Presiñano is 56 years old. He lives with his wife and children in his own home in the village of Guayaquil, a rural area in the Cayalti district where the community works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living raising and selling animals such as rams, ducks, and chickens. For the past 10 years, his business has been located in the area behind his house. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 nuevos soles to buy more animals and feed. He hopes to sell at higher prices in order to generate more income and in this way improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed to raise them.

loans.name: Gustavo De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo es un fabricador de implementos de aseo básicamente de trapeadoras y escobas las cuales realiza artesanalmente, presento una gran dificultada y es que pro problemas de salud estuvo ausente de su negocio pro más de 4 meses lo que afecto enormemente su economía pues es la única persona que ingresa dinero en su hogar.

Añadido a esto realiza trabajos de construcción y sueña con tener un terreno para iniciar la construcción de su hogar.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para realizar sus traperas y escobas, como lo son palos, hilos especiales, su idea principal es comprar en grandes cantidades para tener un mejor margen de calidad.

Para Gustavo es importante este crédito pues al estar incapacitado 4 meses su economía se vio gravemente afectada y está en muchas deudas y quiere comenzar a salir de ellas y para ello necesita materia para trabajar.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a cleaning supplies maker, basically of mops and brooms, that he makes by hand. He was presented with a great difficulty due to health problems that kept him absent from his business for more than 4 months. This affected his finances enormously since he is the only person in his home that earns money.

In addition to making brooms and mops, he performs construction work and dreams of having land to begin the construction of his home. He is requesting a loan to buy materials to make his mops and brooms. Materials like posts and special yarn. His main idea is to buy in large quantities to obtain better quality margins.

This loan is important to Gustavo because after being incapacitated for 4 months his finances were grossly affected and he has many debts to pay. He wants to start paying back those debts, and to do this, he needs materials to work.

loans.use: to buy posts and special yarn to make mops and brooms.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past 2 years Aidah has been working hard to manage her small clothes business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more women's clothes for resale, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger boutique with male clothes too.

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more women's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima's Group is comprised of two hardworking women. Halima herself is twenty years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years she has been working hard to manage a small business where she sells clothes.

Halima and her group partner are applying for a 1,200,000 UGX loan through BRAC Uganda, from which Halima will receive 900,000 UGX. She will use this loan to buy more new clothes to sell. She hopes to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. She would like to build rental housing in the future.

Halima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Agagul

texts.en: Agagul is 44 year old, married with two children. Agagul is a farmer. He is asking for a loan of 600 AZN so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops. Vegetable gardening is a big business for many rural farmers in his region. Agagul grows vegetables on his small farm to sell at one of the roadside markets. His father helps him in this business. Last season he grew cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers and watermelons. His monthly income is 110 AZN from this business. He needs your financial support. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of clothing material to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk, drinks and pure water to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional plastic slippers and clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a married mother of three, born in 1986, and she has a secondary level of education. As her husband’s salary was limited, she decided to work side by side with him to increase their income and cover their children's needs and expenses.
For the last 9 years, Mirna has been working hard from her house sewing shoes. Due to high living expenses she is suffering from low finances. Thus, she is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school fees.
This loan will help Mirna keep her children at school and guarantee their future. She hopes that one day she can open her own shoe sewing business.

loans.use: To  pay her childrens' school fees

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is a careful mother of 3 children. Her husband is a migrant. Lola has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 8 years. She feeds cattle some months and sells in a local market. Lola manages with this business alone. She feeds cattle in her house, where she has a cowshed. She needs financial support now. She is ill and she must treat herself. Lola is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy medicine for her treatment. She really needs to your financials support and awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Juan Alveiro

texts.es:
Juan es un productor agropecuario cultivar de frijol, padre de un hijo de 10 años de edad y con un feliz matrimonio el cual tuvo grandes dificultades climáticas por granizadas que arrasaron sus cultivos y perdió todo por lo que no puede centrar toda su actividad económica en cultivos. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de ganado de levante con lo que aprovechara campos que tiene libres y los ocupara con ganado, este crédito será muy importante pues tendrá otra actividad económica que le ayude con los ingresos económicos y el monto es elevado debido a que el ganado es costoso y no tiene como asumir estos gatos directamente por lo que acude al crédito.

Con el crédito ganara una actividad económica que pueda suplirlo en dificultades o en temporada fría de cultivación. 

Su principal sueño es tener una gran finca llena de cultivos y animales para prosperar y vivir feliz con su amada familia
texts.en:
Juan is a bean farmer, father of a ten-year-old son, and happily married. His farm experienced great climate difficulties as hailstorms destroyed his crops and he lost everything. For this reason he cannot focus all of his business in growing crops.

He is requesting a loan to buy livestock to raise so he can take advantage of the free fields and let the livestock occupy them. This loan will be very important because he will have another business activity that will help with his income. The loan amount is higher because livestock is very expensive and Juan does not have a way to take on those costs directly, which is why he is requesting a loan.

With the loan, he will gain an activity that can supplement his business during difficulties or in cold seasons for farming. His main dream is to have a large farm full of crops and animals so he can thrive and live happily with his loving family.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a married mother of 4 kids and was born in 1956. She started helping her husband in covering their family’s needs by opening a fruits and vegetables selling shop 2 years ago. Now Zahra is looking forward to expand her business and increase her income. She wants to benefit from a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a refrigerator for her shop and increase her business merchandise with new products. This loan will affect Zahra’s profit positively; she will be able to plan for a better future for her kids.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her shop and increase her business merchandise with new products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to his business

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Hello lenders! Meet Lily, a 33 year-old farmer from Litein in Kenya. She resides with her 34 year-old husband with whom they are blessed with 2 boys and 1 daughter. Lily has been actively involved in farming for the last 10 years. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at a local town. She enjoys dairy farming - Milking her cows is her hobby. The biggest challenge she faces is a lack of exotic breeds in the market. These breeds have very desirable traits that make them more productive and valuable to dairy farmers. To solve this problem, Lily is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an additional dairy cow. Having an additional cow will provide her with a lot of practical benefits. She believes the pasture she gives to her cows provides great-tasting dairy products that are more nutritious and flavourful than those processed and sold at shops. She will also be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume.  In the short run, she will be saving the returns to buy a motorcycle that will aid transportation of farm produce to further markets. In the long run, she will have saved enough money to go for better breeds of cows. Lily’s dream is to build her capital and asset base in order to lead a financially secured life in future.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Meet Maureen, a mother of 9, who for the last 9 years has been farming in a small village in Litein, Kenya. She generates income selling milk and tea produced at her farm. 
Over the years, Maureen has found that the most enjoyable thing about her work is milking.  The fact that she loves her cows can be seen right from the names she has given them. One of the cows is named ‘Rembo.’ This is a Swahili word denoting beauty. However, lack of sufficient capital is a challenge that bars her from expanding her business.  
Maureen is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. A typical cow she is looking to buy produces an average of 15 to 20 liters every single day. This amount of milk will greatly boost her sales volume. The money from the sales of the additional milk will enable her to pay her loan obligation without any trouble and still manage to keep extra money for other business-related uses. 
The additional income she will make after successfully repaying the loan will be channeled to other projects she currently has on hold.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel, 44, is a very passionate dairy farmer based near Litein which is a popular tea growing region in Kenya. He is committed to a lovely wife with whom they have been blessed with 3 children. Samwel has been doing mixed farming for the last 15 years to provide for his family. His primary income sources are milk, tea and other varieties of crops. Samwel is also engaged in other small personal businesses. He has stated that he enjoys dairy farming very much. His biggest challenge, however, is disease outbreaks in the region. Samwel is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow after assessing the persistent demand for milk in Kisisara. With this loan, he is going for productive animals with average production of 15 litres of milk per day. Having understood the market requirements, he wants to expand his dairy farm in a modern manner with more animals so that he can diversify the farm’s products. Your loan will help Samwel make enough money to settle his high family expenses. He has stated that the loan will benefit his family by providing him with the financial ability to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc and rice for resale.

loans.name: Mwasiti's Group

texts.en:
"MWASITI's group is comprised of two hard working women. MWASITI is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, MWASITI has been working hard to manage her small charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand  her business, MWASITI has requested a loan of 250000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of charcoal for resale, and will help MWASITI to generate greater profits and take care of her family. MWASITI hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into wholesale. 

MWASITI is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy cakes, biscuits, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Tsui-Shitoo 3 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is the group representative from Osu-Accra, Ghana. She is a 41-year-old married woman. She has a small family comprising five members: her husband and three sons, aged 3, 11 and 18.  

Juliana is managing a cosmetics business door to door to maintain her family. Her husband helps her to get cosmetics from the wholeseller and sell them to customers. 

Juliana, along with five other members of her locality from Tsui-Shitoo 3 Group have come to ID-Ghana for a loan to develop their existing businesses.

She has been making a good monthly income from this business, but it is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a loan to buy enough cosmetics and sell them to customers. She has a cherished dream to have her own stall in her locality and educate her children in a better college so they can be employed in the government sector.

The other five members of her group are Cynthia, Nora, Regina, Edith and Elizabeth.

loans.use: to buy enough cosmetics and sell to customers.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 41-year-old married woman, who lives alone in Tbilisi city. She can't find a stable job and the only source of income for her is assistance from her family, who live in the village. 
Nino has great desire to start her own business and not be dependent on her family. She requested a loan for opening a fruit and vegetable shop in a good location and serve clients herself. She has already rented a place and now wants money to purchase stock and have money for working capital. After several unsuccessful attempts, Nino's request was approved by MFO Credo. This business will be profitable, she thinks, as it has good location and Nino will always have fresh products and will get regular costumers. 

The loan will be great support for this motivated woman, as she will be able to generate her income and become financially independent. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To open a fruit and vegetable shopto generate her own income

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna, tiene 39 años de edad, su estado civil es casada tiene 2 hijos dependientes que vive en el Distrito de cayalti, una comunidad con clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, a la venta de animales y comercio que se ubica en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Se dedica a la venta de patos y pavos; asi también como a la agicultura, con más de 02 años en el negocio, por lo tanto a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3400 nuevos soles para la compra de un vehículo mototaxi y asi incrementar sus ingresos y ganancias, mejorando su cailad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Giovanna, 39 years old, her civil status is married and she has 2 dependent children, they live in the Cayalti district, a community with a varied climate, her village works in agriculture, selling animals and trade, it is located in the Chiclayo Provence, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works selling ducks and turkeys; also in farming as well, with more that 2 years in the business, so she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3400 nuevos soles to purchase a motorcycle taxi vehicle and thus increase her earnings and profits, improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
José un hombre con una actividad muy particular la cual es la venta de limones al x mayor, actividad de la cual se siente muy orgullo pues con ella ha sacado a sus hijos adelante y compro su casa, muy humilde pero tiene el orgullo de decir que es suya.

Distribuye sus limones en una motocicleta por todas las veredas llevando el producto al hogar del cliente pero presenta un gran problema y es que el seguro de su moto caduca y para seguir operando debe conseguirlo cuanto antes pues de manejar sin seguro corre el riego de que se la quiten. 

Por eso solicita un crédito para comprar el seguro de su moto y seguir operando su particular profesión. 

Sueña con cubrir más veredas y poder tener ingresos para realizar algunos arreglos y mejoras a su casa.

Apoyen a este humilde hombre que solo demuestra que cualquier empleo es digno y si lo sabes operar consigues grandes cosas como tu hogar.
texts.en:
Jose is a man with a distinctive field of activity, which is selling limes in bulk.   He is proud that through this work he has helped his children get ahead. He also bought his house, a humble place to live, but Jose is proud to say that it belongs to him. 

He distributes his limes on a motorcycle through all the streets, bringing them to the customers' homes. However, there is a big problem, and that is that the insurance on his motorcycle is running out and to keep operating it, he should get a policy as soon as possible.  When driving without insurance he runs the risk of having his motorcycle taken away.

For this reason, Jose is asking for a loan to pay for an insurance policy for his motorcycle and continue working in his special field.  He dreams of covering more streets and having enough income to make repairs and improvements to his house.   This humble man shows that every form of employment is dignified and if you know how to do it well you can succeed in getting big things like your home.

loans.use: to pay for his motorcycle insurance policy so he can keep working

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Dynamic Jezza School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Nsubuga. He is an administrator at Dynamic Secondary School a mixed school located in Jezza, Wakiso District with 100 students. Dynamic Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultrafiltration water system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra filtration water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Dynamic Secondary Jezza, will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Nsubuga ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a 42-year-old woman who hails from Maynaguri. She is blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter). She has received education up to grade 4 only. She lives in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw) in a small village of Maynaguri with her husband and three children. Their eldest son works as a mason, and the other two children are students of grade 12 and grade 10.

Purnima's son's income is irregular, so it hardly covers the food expenses of a five-member family. To earn extra income for her family, Purnima has engaged herself with a milk-selling business. She has a dairy cow, which gives real, delicious and ecologically pure milk to her neighbors and the local residents. There is a lot of demand for her cow milk, and Purnima's number of customers increases day by day; that is why she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy another dairy cow. She plans to use the profit from her dairy business to further increase her business, and she also plans to save up money to admit her children in a renowned school so that they can establish themselves as noble citizens in the future.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for continuing her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is from Maynaguri. She is a married woman of only 25 years, and an active and energetic entrepreneur. Her family consists of her husband, Dharya Mohan, and two little kids (one son and one daughter). After her marriage, she started rearing cattle. Purnima has an education up to grade 4, whereas her husband attended school till eighth standard.

Her husband, aged 27 years, has been working in their agricultural farm. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells the produce to the local markets. Purnima practices livestock breeding for an additional income for the family. Purnima sells milk and dairy products (butter, cottage cheese, curds, etc.) to local residents. She also sells cow dung to generate more income. In rural areas, cow dung is very much essential for manure, and cow dung cake is used as a firewood for cooking purposes. As all of Purnima's enterprises are eco-friendly, homemade and exceptionally delicious, there is a high demand for her products, and her number of customers is growing gradually.

This is why Purnima is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy a dairy cow to increase her income from the sale of milk and dairy products.  Purnima plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

Her dreams are to give a steady income to her family and provide her children a good education.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her business.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 37-year-old housewife from Maynaguri. She is married to Raghunath, who is a cycle-van puller by profession. They are illiterate and can sign their names only. They have two children (one son and one daughter). Both are receiving an education and are in grade 5 and grade 7. They live in Mouyamari, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district.

Saraswati's husband is a person of good conduct. He learned to drive vehicles and cycle-rickshaws from a very young age, and he inherited this activity from his father.

He offers daily van service to ensure financial support for the family. It is a kind of transport, which is widely used in rural areas of West Bengal to carry loads and people. For him, not all days are the same; sometimes there are bad days and good days, but little by little he is overcoming the financial situation. But his cycle-van has gotten damaged, as it is an old one. He needs to purchase a new cycle-van immediately; otherwise, the only source of income for the family will be stopped.

Saraswati requests a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) for her husband to help him to buy a new van. In this way, he will bring better service to his customers.

Her main purpose for the future is to see her children be well-educated and well-established. To this end, she has set herself the goal of saving a percentage of her daily income to be able to accumulate most of the money for a healthy future.

She is thankful to Kiva and BJS for the loan opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a single Palestinian refugee, born in 1990, who lives in a Palestinian refugee’s camp. The difficulties of life for Palestinian refugees in Lebanon and the low financial situation of his family didn’t affect his will. He continued his studies until he received a university certificate.

Four years ago, he decided to manage his father’s small grocery shop, which allowed him to learn more about business rules, especially since the store is located inside his house. 

Now, he is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify his business merchandise with new products and special offers attractive to his customers.

Mohammad hopes to improve his shop and gain more profit, which will help him build a better future.

loans.use: To purchase new products to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Hello lender, meet Eunice. She is a smallholder mixed farmer based in Mukure village in Kerugoya, Kenya. She is married to a lovely husband with whom she has been blessed with two daughters. For the last six years, Eunice has been selling milk, eggs, tea and other crops produced at her farm in the local market.

Lately, Eunice noticed a growing demand for pig products. She has done her homework and realized that she stands to greatly boost her income if only she could venture into pig farming soon. A sow delivers twice a year with up to 16 piglets at a single go. A piglet in Kenya goes for KES 3,000 ($34). The pig business could very well be Eunice's way out of poverty. 

She is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase a male and a female pig. She wants to start small and grow her expertise in pig farming over time with the gradual growth of the business. Her goals are very realistic and achievable.

With your loan, Eunice will tap into this very unmissable opportunity. The money made from the initial investment in pig farming will enable her to afford other farm-related expenses. Her family at large will benefit from the extra income they stand to make.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs

loans.name: Gabriel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Gabriel tiene 37 años de edad, es una persona que se ha tenido que sacrificar trabajando arduamente, primeramente por sus hermanos y hoy por su compañera de vida e hijo. Estudió hasta tercer grado, dejó de estudiar por la necesidad de apoyar a su madre, llevando ingresos al hogar.

Gabriel ha cultivado la tierra durante muchos años, actualmente también trabaja como cobrador de buses, él labora de lunes a domingo de 5:00am a 1:00pm y en la tarde se dedica al mantenimiento de sus cultivos.

El préstamo que solicita a CrediCampo es para comprar insumos agrícolas (fertilizantes y semilla), también para pagar el arrendamiento del terreno donde cultiva, así podrá tener sus alimentos básicos para el año que viene.

Uno de sus mayores sueños es poder mejorar las condiciones de vivienda de su familia, ya que su casa se encuentra un poco deteriorada.
texts.en:
Gabriel, 37, is someone who has had to sacrifice by working hard, first for his siblings and now for his companion and his son.  He attended school up to third grade and stopped because he needed to bring income into the household to help his mother.

Gabriel has farmed for many years.  Currently he also works as a bus conductor.  He works Monday through Sunday from 5 a.m. until 1 p.m. and takes care of his crop in the afternoon.

The loan he's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy agricultural inputs (fertilizer and seeds) and to pay the rent on the land he farms.  That way he'll have all his basic food for the coming year.

One of his biggest dreams is to be able to improve his family's house, because it's a little run down.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay the rent on the land he farms

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo emprendedor y con mucha ambición hacia el futuro de poder llegar a ser alguien diferente en la vida es casado de 32 años de edad tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 5 años de edad los tres de ellos son buenos estudiantes en la escuela de la comunidad donde residen, sus hijos ha sido el motivo por el que él se ha decidido a emprender el negocio de abarrotería  negocio que deja una muy buena ganancia en un futuro.
La actividad que el dignamente realiza es la compraventa de abarrotería pues los aprendió en un trabajo que el tubo unos cuantos años atrás y le genero algunos ahorros por su trabajo realizados en dicha empresa donde trabajo por más de tres años experiencia suficiente para Timoteo para poder emprender su propio negocio en su propio comunidad y obtener sus propias ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. Su segunda actividad que el realiza es la de transportar personas en su moto taxi por doquier en los rincones de su comunidad.
