El uso respectivo que él le dará al crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercadería para poder surtir su tienda y así no perder a sus clientes porque por medio de ellos es que puede tener un ingreso para la satisfacción de sus necesidades y la de su familia.
Uno de sus aspiraciones en los próximos años es ver a sus hijos convertirse en mejores profesionales y que ellos tengan ese futuro de éxito en sus campos laborales y en la vida.
texts.en:
Timoteo is enterprising and with a lot of ambition for the future has been able to become a different person in his life.  He is married, 32 years old, has 3 children ages 11, 9 and 5 and the three are good students in the school in their community. His children have been the motivation for which he has decided to take on a grocery store business, a business which gives a very good profit in the future. 

The work that he does with dignity is the trade of groceries since he learned the work some years ago and he had generated some savings from his work in a similar business where he has worked for over three years.  This is sufficient experience for Timoteo to be able to open his own business in his own community and earn his own income for the well-being of his family. The second job that he does is to transport people on his motorcycle taxi to all of the corners of his community.

The use that he will give the loan that he has requested is to purchase merchandise to be able to stock his store, and in this way not lose his customers because, through them, he is able to have an income to satisfy his needs and those of his family.

One of his aspirations for the next few years is to see his children become better professionals and that they have this successful future in their fields of work and in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store to attract more customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as oil, rice, coal, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past eight months, Esther has been working hard to manage her small vegetable business, which sells vegetables.

To help expand the business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, onions and carrots to sell, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land so as to start planting her own vegetables.

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, onions and carrots to sell

loans.name: Ricardo Jose

texts.es:
Las personas recuerdan a Ricardo cuando empezó a vender por las calles collares, pulseras y anillos artesanales. Ahora, a sus 22 años este comerciante ha podido incrementar sus productos de venta, de cuando inició hace cuatro años, ya que como expresa con una gran sonrisa, se siente agradecido con MiCrédito, KIVA y con todas las personas que le extendieron la mano cuando necesitaba de un préstamo. El préstamo anterior lo utilizó para comprar camisetas, pinzas, perlas de cristal, piedras de colores, metal plateado, entre otros productos que ayudaron a incrementar los ingresos. Su hijo y su esposa, de la cual está encargado, son su inspiración principal para seguir creciendo.
Por esta razón, Ricardo  con el apoyo de su hermana, más el de su hermano, ha decidido evolucionar, por lo que necesita de un préstamo nuevo para comprar una moto, para poder movilizar la mercadería a las tiendas o el mercado, sin gastar mucho en buses, como lo ha hecho anteriormente. Al cancelar piensa buscar otra inversión, pues a pesar de sentirse autosuficiente, quiere seguir desarrollándose con algunos créditos hasta llegar a tener una tienda.
texts.en:
People remembered Ricardo when he began to sell artesanal necklaces, bracelets, and rings on the streets.  Now, at the age of 22, this businessman has been able to increase his line of products from what he offered 4 years ago.  As he says with a smile, he feels grateful to MiCrédito, Kiva, and everyone who lent him a hand when he needed a loan.  He used his first loan to buy t-shirts, clothespins, pearl beads, colored stones, and silver-plated metal, among other products that helped him to increase his income.  His wife and son, for whom he is responsible, are his source of inspiration to keep growing.

For this reason, with the help of his sister and brother, Ricardo has decided to adapt.  And so he needs a loan to buy a motorcycle in order to be able to carry his merchandise to stores or the market without spending as much as he has in the past on buses.  When he pays it off, he is thinking about asking for a new loan because, in spite of feeling self-sufficient, he wants to keep growing with loans until he has his own store.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to bring his merchandise to the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to go to Medellín to buy a variety of clothing, linens, and quilts to provide better products and one day stop selling on the streets and own a shop.

loans.name: Yanci Cloribel

texts.es:
Yanci de 27 años de edad, estaba casada pero su esposo la abandonó, tiene 2 hijos que son menores de edad, ella vive en casa de su madre. 

Yanci tiene un chalet frente a la escuela de su comunidad, el cual administra junto con su madre, además elabora tamales de elote y pollo, por las tardes para obtener un ingreso extra y los sale a vender de manera ambulante.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar elote, pollo, hojas para envolver, condimentos, etc; ya que les ha ido muy bien y quieren aprovechar esta oportunidad de negocio, además invertirá en comprar bebidas, golosinas, pan, embutidos, etc para vender en el chalet.


 Ella espera que su negocio sea estable y contar siempre con la solvencia económica para que estudien sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yanci, 27 years old, was married, but her husband abandoned her.  She has two minor children, and lives in her mother's house.

Yanci has a detached house in front of the community school, which she manages with her mother.  She also make tamales made of corn and chicken in the afternoon to earn extra money as a street vendor. 

She needs the loan to purchase corn, chicken, wrappers, condiments, etc, since it has gone very well for them, and they want to take advantage of this business opportunity.  She will also invest in purchasing drinks, sodas, bread, and sausage to sell out of her house. She hopes that her business is stable and that she is always financially solvent so that her children can study until they become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase corn, chicken, wrappers, condiments for her tamale sales, and also to purchase drinks, sodas, bread, and sausage to expand what she can offer customers

loans.name: Eliana Maria

texts.es:
Eliana es una joven de 23 años de edad que a partir de trabajo y esfuerzo ha ido forjando su vida, trabajo realizando manicure y pedicura a domicilio.

Aprendió su actividad gracias a unos cursos que poco a poco ha realizado, y quiere solicitar un crédito para tener materia para realizar su trabajo, como variedad de barnice, removedores, instrumentos de trabajo como cortaúñas, pinzas, separador de dedos, poncheras etc.

El crédito para ella será de gran importancia pues gracias a este tendrá variedad para ofrecer el diseño de las uñas para sus clientes. 

Espera poder seguir ejerciendo su profesión y en un futuro tener un spa de uñas, una casa propia y muchos sueños que tiene y sabe que con trabajo y humildad lo lograra, pide un voto de confianza y que le presten para mejorar su servicio y devolverá con resultados esa confianza que espera que depositen en ella.
texts.en:
Eliana is a young woman of 23 years of age, who through working and effort has forged her life, working doing manicures and pedicures from home.

She learnt this trade through some courses she took bit by bit, and she wants to request a loan to have the things she needs to do her work, like a variety of files, polish removers, work tools such as nail clippers, tweezers, toe separators, foot baths, etc.

The loan for her is of great importance as thanks to it, she will be able to offer a variety of designs for her customers' nails.

She hopes to be able to continue in her profession and in the future have a nail spa, her own house and many dreams that she has and knows that with work and humility she will reach them, she asks for a vote of confidence and that everyone will loan to her to improve her services and she will return with the results of this trust that she hopes everyone will invest in her.

loans.use: to buy nail files, nail polish remover and tools for her manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Om Taha Group

texts.en:
Om Taha is a group which comprises four women members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Karima is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old widowed woman, living with her parents in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. Karima is a very active and dynamic woman and works as a housewife, and her father is the sole breadwinner of the family. He is an employee as a solider in the army. His income is not enough to cover all of the expenses of the family, especially on the food side. As a result, the family crosses with a financial crisis most days inside the house. This crisis makes them lack most food materials inside the house. Therefore, Karima applied for a loan of 20,000 YER in order to purchase food materials for the house, such as flour, sugar, meats, potatoes and tomatoes, and other food materials, in order to face all the demands of the family's need of food inside the house and to make delicious meals for her family.

Karima looks forward to improving the living standards of her family. She hopes to build the second floor of the house.

loans.use: to purchase food for the family to eat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store with arepas, brown sugar, bread, and oil

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es:
Julieth:
Julieth tiene 22 años y nació en Barranquilla, Atlántico, población ubicada en el norte de Colombia. Es la hija mayor de su familia, sus dos hermanos menores aún estudian en el colegio, su madre es docente en la Universidad del Norte y su padre actualmente no cuenta con un empleo. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que tuvieron, Julieth logró obtener una beca completa que le permitió estudiar Psicología en la Universidad del Norte, obteniendo el título profesional en Febrero del 2014, terminado en el primero puesto de su promoción. 
El principal objetivo que tiene Julieth, es el de poder realizar una maestría en Psicología Educativa en una Universidad en el exterior, y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma y aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Julieth anhela trabajar en Programas de bilingüismo nacionales, vinculándose con proyectos de la región con los estudiantes desde el colegio, buscando la descentralización de la enseñanza de idiomas por medio de educación pública de calidad sobre todo en las zonas vulnerables.
Aquí está su historia: 
Su familia ha sido siempre mi la base de todos los proyectos que ha iniciado, por esto, a lo largo de toda su vida, le han dado su apoyo incondicional. En este nuevo sueño no ha sido diferente, y aunque no cuentan con los recursos económicos para ayudarle, le brindan su ayuda de varias formas, como ayudándola a buscar los mejores programas, en la mejores universidades, lo cual valora inmensamente. 
La educación es uno de los pilares sobre los cuales se construyen las principales características de una sociedad; por este motivo, es un tema que merece especial atención si se busca una solución estratégica a la crisis  que vive Colombia. Vale la pena entonces que los profesionales se atrevan a trabajar por un sistema educativo que forme líderes capaces de generar cambios positivos desde sus potencialidades, teniendo en cuenta las historias, cualidades, limitaciones, intereses y motivaciones particulares de cada aprendiz, las cuales influyen en la calidad y el ritmo de su proceso. 
Ahora bien, la oportunidad de estudiar en un país extranjero donde se manejan ideas y modelos educativos distintos, le permitiría nutrirse de lo que ha resultado efectivo en otros escenarios, formas diferentes de afrontar problemáticas y/o situaciones similares; para luego ser capaz de producir y llevar a cabo soluciones coherentes con el contexto colombiano, empleando los elementos adquiridos para insertar transformaciones que combinen las perspectivas internacionales con la realidad nacional.
Actualmente Julieth se encuentra trabajando medio tiempo en una empresa enfocada en la investigación de psicología del consumo, coordinando un proyecto de psicología educativa; y al mismo tiempo se desempeña como investigadora de campo en un proyecto de investigación en la Universidad del Norte. Sin embargo, el dinero que gana lo reparte para ayudar en la manutención de mi hogar y en ahorrar para llevar a cabo su sueño, sin embargo este ahorro no es suficiente para llevar a cabo todos los trámites necesarios y cumplir con los requisitos para ser aceptada en la universidad. Por esto solicita el apoyo por parte de KIVA para completar los requisitos de idioma y de papeleo para la inscripción de la Maestría.
texts.en:
Julieth is 22 years old and was born in Barranquilla, Atlántico, a town located in northern Colombia.  She is the eldest daughter in her family.  Her two younger siblings are in high school, her mother is a professor in the Universidad del Norte, and her father is currently unemployed.  Despite the economic hardships that they faced, Julieth was able to obtain a full scholarship that allowed her to study Psychology in the Universidad del Norte.  She earned her professional degree in February of 2014, finishing at the top of her class.  

Julieth's primary goal is to be able to complete her Masters in Educational Psychology in a university abroad.  In order to achieve this, she is seeking support from Kiva because it is the only way she will be able to cover the costs of the language exams and the university application fees.  Once she completes her degree and returns to Colombia, Julieth plans to work in the national bilingual programs, creating projects in the region with high school students seeking to decentralize language education through quality public education throughout all of the vulnerable regions.

Her family has always been the foundation for all of the projects that she has started.  During the entirety of her life, they have given her unconditional support.  In this new dream of hers, it has not been any different, and although they do not have the financial resources to help her, they have supported her in different ways such as helping her to find the best programs in the best universities, which she values immensely.  Education is one of the pillars on which the main characteristics of a society are built.  For this reason, it is a subject that deserves special attention when seeking a solution to the current crises in Colombia. Therefore, it is worth it for professionals to work in educational systems to develop capable leaders to generate positive change through them by taking into account their individual history, qualities, limitations, interests and specific motivators.  

The opportunity to study in a foreign country where there are different educational models and ideas will allow her to nourish herself with the things that have been effective in different settings, and different ways of facing problems and situations so that later she can develop and implement coherent solutions within the context of Colombia, employing what she have acquired to combine international perspectives with the national reality.

Currently, she is working part-time in a business that focuses on psychological studies of consumption.  She coordinate an educational psychology project.  At the same time, she is working as a field researcher for a research study in the Universidad del Norte.  However, she divides the money that she earns between helping with the household expenses and saving to reach her dream.  Unfortunately, these savings are not enough to cover all of the necessary expenses to fulfill the requirements to be accepted in a university.  For this reason, she is seeking support from Kiva to complete the language requirements and the paperwork to enroll in a masters program.

loans.use: the pay for the application fees for a Master of Educational Psychology in a university abroad.

loans.name: Coralia Katherine

texts.es:
Coralia tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con la madre en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Coralia  se dedicaba, a la venta de confiteria. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderia y asi poder aumentar el negocio. Las compras realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar las ventas y comprarse una casa. Su desafío es tener una enfermedad cronica. En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar y atender su negocio.
texts.en:
Coralia is 20 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in the town of Ventanas in the Province of Los Ríos. 

Coralia works selling candies. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise and thus be able to increase her business.  She makes her purchases in the town of Ventanas.  Her goal is to improve her sales and to buy a house.  Her challenge is having a chronic illness.  In her free time she likes to relax and take care of her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for candy sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
It's a normal thing to have a chicken farm in Kenya, but to start an actual business out of it is something else entirely. Rose is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Ndunguri village. She is the mother of two, who has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years.

To earn a decent living, she makes income selling milk, tea, greens and engaging in numerous small personal businesses including transportation via Indian motorcycles.

Only recently, she started seeing how she could be making big money off poultry farming. Raising hens to Rose is something close to a hobby. She wants to sell eggs but figures the quantity she produces won't make economic sense. She needs to purchase more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand.

Rose is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry.

Future proceeds from the commercialization of her poultry farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos dependientes, vive en el Distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad con clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, a la venta de animales y comercio que se ubica en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Vilma Se dedica a la venta de patos y pavos con más de 02 años en el negocio, por lo tanto a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca lechera, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos, mejorando sus ganancias y por ende la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is 31 years old, she lives with her partner, she has 4 dependent children, she lives in the Cayalti district, a community with a variable climate, her village works in agriculture, animal sales and trade, it is located in the Chiclayo Provence, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Vilma works selling ducks and turkeys, she has been in this business for 2 years, so she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000  nuevos soles to buy a dairy cow, which will enable her to increase her income, improving her profits and and hence the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Salimah

texts.en:
Salima is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Salima has been working hard to manage her clothes business where she sells clothes. 

To help expand the business, Salima has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell and will help Salima to generate greater profits, take care of her son and manage to put him in better schools. Salima hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a bigger supplier of clothes in town. 

Salima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old, married to Nancy and blessed with five children whose are between 10 and 1 years old .He has been running a food stall where he sells a variety of dishes to his customers for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
He has applied for his first loan of 22,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, plates and spoons for service.                                                                                        

Charles will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be able to educate his children to a  higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, plates and spoons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers, plastic buckets and flasks to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosario Emilia

texts.es:
Rosario es una joven soltera, con 25 años de edad, vive en Ica junto a su familia. Es una joven muy talentosa, gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a su esfuerzo constante está estudiando la carrera de Administración en un Instituto y le va muy bien porque tiene muchos deseos de superación y estudia bastante. También, para apoyar a sus padres trabaja como Agente de Venta en una prestigiosa empresa y tiene excelentes resultados en su trabajo porque labora con profesionalismo y ética.
Rosario piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar un escritorio para hacer sus trabajos de la Universidad y un ropero para poder amoblar su dormitorio. De esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida, ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por todo el apoyo que le han brindado, así seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder terminar su carrera profesional y poder cumplir una de sus más grandes metas: "Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Rosario, 25, is single and lives in Ica with her family.  She is a very talented young lady who, thanks to the support of her parents and her constant efforts, is studying business administration at the institute.  It is going well for her because she wants to get ahead and studies considerably.  Also, in order to support her parents she works as a sales agent at a prestigious firm with excellent results in her job because of her professionalism and ethics.

Rosario plans to use the loan to buy a desk to do her university work and a wardrobe to furnish her bedroom.  This will improve her quality of life.  She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support which encourages her to continue striving to finish her degree and meeting one of her biggest goals which is "To have her own house".

loans.use: To buy a desk and a wardrobe.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Don Salvador, tiene 54 años de edad, está casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive con con su esposa e hijos en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe. El se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años cultivando maíz, frijoles y café. La producción que le da mayor ingreso es el café el cual vende en pergamino a los intermediarios que llegan a la zona a comprar.  Esta solicitando el sexto ciclo de préstamo que es por 25,000 lempiras, este mismo lo invertirá en la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra por limpieza y aplicación de abono a tres manzanas de finca de café y poder sacar mayor producción cada año. Su meta es poder cultivar un área más de café para mejorar la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador, 54, is married and has four children.  The family lives in a village of the municipality of Taulabe.  He has worked in agriculture for many years growing corn, beans and coffee.  Coffee production earns the greatest income from sales to dealers who visit the area.

He is requesting his sixth loan, in the amount of 25,000 HNL, to buy fertilizer and pay labor to clean and fertilizer his coffee plantation.  This is so he can produce more every year.  His goal is to plant more coffee to improve his family's economic situation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor to clean and fertilize his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of electronics items like cables, light fans, televisions, bulb radios and switches.

loans.name: Anna's Group

texts.en:
Anna's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Anna is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, Anna has been working hard to manage her small vegetable business where she sells vegetables. 

To help expand the business, Anna has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables and fresh food for sale and will help Anna to generate greater profits, take care of herself and focus on her goals. Anna hopes that in the future, will be able to become a powerful businesswoman. 

Anna is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fresh food to sell

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Teddy is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past three years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells produce.

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce like beans, rice and maize flour to sell, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and help her go for higher studies. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to become a better businesswoman.

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more produce like beans, rice and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Juana Mayela

texts.es:
Juana de 26 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad. Es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal,  En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar con su hijo, en la actualidad luchan día a día para bríndale estabilidad  emocional y económica a su hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva como: pantalones, shores, faldas, blusas, ropa de cama, ropa interior, vestidos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias de forma ambulante y por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Juana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juana is 26 years old. She is married and has a minor son. She is from León, located in the western part of the country. She is characterized as hardworking, responsible, and wanting to get ahead. She enjoys spending her free time with her son.  Right now, she fights day to day to offer her son a better life. 

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to get ahead, her economic activity is selling clothes such as, pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, bed linen, underwear and dresses. She spends around 10 hours a day selling her products as a street vendor. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business so that in the not so distant future she can obtain better income. Juana is grateful to for the help the Kiva lenders offer to low income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, bed linen, underwear and dresses for her business.

loans.name: Santos Porfirio

texts.es: Don Santos, tiene 46 años de edad, está en una relación de unión libre, tiene 5 hijos y vive con su pareja e hijos en una aldea  del municipio de Taulabe. El se dedica a la agricultura en la producción de caña de azúcar, este cultivo lo tiene hace 15 años. Anteriormente trabajó como operario de maquila y luego decidió por tener su propio cultivo. Esta producción la vende a la compañía Azucarera. El  préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra por limpieza y aplicación de abono a 3 manzanas de cultivo de caña. Lo cual le ayudara a darle mejor  asistencia al cultivo de caña para tener una mayor producción.
texts.en:
Santos is 46 years old, he is in a common-law marriage, he has 5 children and he lives with his partner and children in a village in the Taulabe municipality. He works in agriculture, producing sugarcane, he has had this plantation for 15 years. Previously he worked as a machinery operator and later he decided to have his own plantation. He sells his yield to the sugarcane company. 

The loan requested is the quarter cycle and is for 10,000 lempiras. This money will be used to buy fertilizer and pay for manual labor to clear and apply fertilizer to 3 blocks of sugar cane plantations. This will help to give the sugarcane plantation help to yield a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for manual labor to clear and apply fertilizer to 3 blocks of sugarcane plantations.

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a Palestinian refugee  born in 1967 and living in a Palestinian refugee camp. He is a married father of eight children. 

As a result of the increase in living costs and the tough life in the Palestinian refugee camp, Nimer is suffering from a limited income that is not enough anymore to cover his eight children's expenses. Thus, he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with necessary coffee shop needs. He established the shop in July 2013. He will purchase items such as coffee, sugar and cups. 

Nimer is trying to improve his financial situation to plan a better future for his kids.

loans.use: To purchase more coffee, sugar, cups and necessary items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of motorcycle spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of electronics items like cables, light fans, plugs, bulbs, radios and switches.

loans.name: Adelio Panfilo

texts.es: Don Adelio, tiene 61 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua junto a su esposa, hijos y su padre. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y café. La producción de café es su mayor fuente de ingresos el cual vende en la zona.  Ha solicitado varios préstamos para mantener su cultivo en buen estado, actualmente solicita otro préstamo por  2,500 lempiras para la compra de abono y la fertilizantes y que su cultivo de café se desarrolle mejor y obtener mayor producción. Su meta es siempre salir adelante y dejarle un patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adelio is 61 years old, he lives in a common-law marriage with his partner who he has 2 children with, he lives in a village in the Taulabe municipality, Comayagua, with his wife, children and his father. He has always worked farming staple grains such as corn, beans and coffee. Coffee production is his greatest source of income, which he sells in the area.

He has had several loans to keep his plantation in a good state, currently he is requesting another for 2,500 lempiras to purchase manure and fertilizers so that his coffee plantation develops well and he gets better production. 

His goal is always to get ahead and leave assets for his children.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to grow coffee.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 48 years old and the mother of six children.  She is a housewife and makes sure that all her family needs are met.  She is a responsible mother and supports her family if any problem arises.  

One of her sons is a rickshaw driver by profession.  He has been driving a rickshaw for seven years now.  As a significant portion of their family income is earned from rickshaw driving, her son has to make sure that it runs smoothly.  Due to wear and tear, he must receive regular maintenance and repair.  Because his current income is not sufficient to cover these expenses, he requires money to pay for this maintenance. Therefore, to arrange for funds, Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner, so as to help her son with the rickshaw maintenance. 

She is thankful and happy to be able to help her son.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her son's rickshaw maintenance.

loans.name: M. Shafeeq

texts.en:
M. Shafeeq is a 45-year-old married man, living with his seven children in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a kind and hardworking person.  A carpenter by profession, he keeps on working day and night to make sure that all of his family’s needs are met. Carpentering is his personal business and a source of regular income in the family. He is involved in manufacturing wooden shoe molds in order to supply the shoe manufacturing firms. His wife stays at home, but due to illness is unable to contribute much. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs have increased day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making wooden shoe molds. This is why M. Shafeeq came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan, so he can buy raw materials for making wooden shoe molds. 

He hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business, as well as for his family. Through additional profits he can provide better medical treatment to his sick wife, and more comfort to his entire family. He thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for manufacturing  wooden shoe molds.

loans.name: Yoeng's Group

texts.en:
Aged 29 years, Yoeng is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province. She is a mother of three children. She earns a living through growing cassava and rice, which she had been doing for 10 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR40,000 per day from the current business, and is able to save about 20,000KHR each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Yoeng with VisionFund. Now she is leading her new group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer to support her cassava growing. 

This loan will enable her to support her farmland to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 23 years old and single with no children or dependents. He owns a new phones and radio business and makes extra income through mobile money and phone charging. He started this business to increase his income. He plans to build a house. He will use the loan to buy more phones for selling and buying land.

loans.use: to buy more phones for selling and buying land

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 45-year-old farmer who is married with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After realizing some small cocoa savings, he came up with the idea of a metal workshop in his home area. He has managed to operate on a small scale, though he dreams of educating his children and buying a big cocoa plantation. Competition and limited capital affects his hopes. Hassan is so hardworking and wants a loan to buy angle bars and welding rods to make windows for his customers.

loans.use: to buy angle bars and welding rods to make windows for his customers

loans.name: Teopister

texts.en:
Teopister is 46 years old and has 14 children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in agriculture growing matooke. She also earns a salary as a teacher. She faces the challenges of limited capital and weather changes. 

Teopister is requesting a loan, which which will use to improve her banana plantation by weeding and pruning it. She hopes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to impove her banana plantation by weeding and pruning it.

loans.name: Talat

texts.en:
Talat is a hardworking and empowered woman living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the owner of a stitching center. She is 42 years old and a mother of three. Not only is she an entrepreneur, she is also a committed housewife and looks after her family. She has been running this business for four years. She teaches stitching of a variety of clothes and takes orders. In order to make more clothes, she wants to buy a new Jockey sewing machine as one is not enough to prepare the orders on time. The machine will also help her student learn better. Due to a lack of funds, she has requested a loan. She believes she will pay back the loan amount in easy installments. 

Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur and expand her stitching center.

loans.use: To buy a new Jockey sewing machine for her stitching center

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 66 años de edad, de estado civil viuda tiene 4 hijos dependientes que vive en el Distrito de cayalti, una comunidad con clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, a la venta de animales y comercio que se ubica en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, con más de 20 años en el negocio, y solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales y su posterior reventa, lo que le generará un mayor ingreso, mejores ganacias y por ende mejorará la claidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina, 66, is a widow with four dependent children.  She lives in the district of Cayalti, a community with a varied climate.  The local people work in agriculture, livestock sales and commerce in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells barnyard animals and has been in business for 20 years.  Agustina is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy animals for resale.  This will generate more income and better profits for her, resulting in a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina, tiene 57 años de edad, tiene 1 hija dependiente que vive en el Distrito de Cayalti, la cual es una comunidad con clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, a la venta de animales y comercio; y se ubica en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de de abararrotes tales como el arroz, azucar, aceite, etc. tiene ya más de 15 años en el negocio, a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería e incrementar su stock de productos y poder asi atender a un mayor número de clientes lo que le generá mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende tambien se mejorá la calidad de vida de ella y de su hija.
texts.en:
Sabina, 57, has a dependent daughter and they live in the district of Cayalti which is a community with a varied climate.  The local people work in agriculture, livestock sales and commerce.  It is in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

Sabina sells groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. and has been in business for over 15 years.  The loan she has requested through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3,000 PEN is to buy merchandise to increase product inventory so she can attend to more customers.  This will generate more income and better profits, as well as improve her and her daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise to implement her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cement block, iron, sand

loans.name: Wezenidibam Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de trois femmes battantes travaille avec ACFIME depuis mars 2012 et elles sont toujours à jour de leur remboursement. Jacqueline est la responsable du groupe,elle est veuve et mère de quatre enfants dont trois majeurs et un mineur scolarisé. Jacqueline est gérante de sa propre buvette depuis 2002, elle a cinq(05) employé qu'elle rémunéré chaque mois. Avec ce prêt, elle pourra mieux servir sa clientèle. Le bénéfice lui permettra de payer la scolarité de son enfant mineur.
texts.en: This group comprises three courageous women who have been working with Kiva's partner, ACFIME, since March 2012.  The members of the group have always repaid their loans on time.  Jacqueline, the group's representative, is a widow and the mother of four children (three of her children are adults already, and the fourth one, a minor, is still in school).  Jacqueline has been managing her own bar since 2002.  She employs five people and pays them each month.  Thanks to this loan she will be better able to serve her customers.  The profit from her loan will allow her to pay for her fourth child's school fees.

loans.use: to buy drinks in order to better serve her customers, in her bar.

loans.name: Herlyn Anatonio

texts.es: Herlyn tienen 30 años  es habitante de la comunidad caña de castilla en la escuela comunitaria estudio toda la escuela primaria  dice que aprendió lo básico escribir y leer, ya después sus padres  decidieron que no continuara  y lo pusieron a trabajar en unas manzanas de tierra que tenía su padre  así aprendió  a sembrar maíz , frijoles , café entre otras actividades hoy día él le agradece a su padre que le enseñara como trabajar y ganarse la vida así ha podido hacerse de sus cosas  para cuando se case dice poder ofrecerle algo a su esposa , el aún es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, hace como dos años su padre compro un sistema solar para la casa ya que como en la comunidad aún no ha llegado la energía eléctrica , ellos ya no querían estar a oscuras , ahora es necesario hacer el cambio de la batería para que el sistema siga funcionando bien es por esa razón que hará el trámite de crédito para así comprarla.
texts.en: Herlyn is 30 years old and lives in the Caña de Castilla community. He completed his primary education at the local school, learning the basics - reading and writing. After primary school, Herlyn's parents decided that he could not continue with his education and they sent him to work on the land that Herlyn's father owned. Through this work, Herlyn learned to sow corn, beans and coffee, and other tasks. Today Herlyn is very grateful to his father for teaching him how to work and earn a living. Now Herlyn can look after himself and can offer something to a future wife. Herlyn is still single and living at home. Two years ago Herlyn's father bought a solar power system for the house as the community does not yet have electricity and Herlyn and his family did not want to live in the dark any longer. Now the battery in the solar power systems needs to be changed in order to keep working well. As a result, Herlyn is applying for a loan in order to buy a battery.

loans.use: to buy a battery for his solar power system.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene  47 años de edad vive en la comunidad Cuajiniquil   tristemente dice el solo logro estudiar hasta segundo grado de primaria ya que sus padres no podían  enviarlo a estudiar tanto a él como sus hermanos ya  que la familia era bastante grande   y no habían escuelas cercanas , entonces desde muy temprana edad  aprendió los labores del campo pasaron los años y se casó formo su propia familia  tiene 3 hijos sus hijos están grandes ya ellos le ayudan a trabajar las tierras que tienen y su esposa es ama de casa , en la comunidad  no tienen energía eléctrica , pero el con mucho esfuerzo compro un sistema solar y lo instalo en su vivienda esto ha sido bien beneficioso  para toda su familia , ahorita quiere aplicar a crédito para comprar una batería ya que la que tiene su sistema ya necesita ser reemplazada  para que este siga traicionándole  .
texts.en: Santos is 47 years old and lives in the Cuajiniquil community. Sadly, Santos was only able to study up to second grade at primary school as his parents could not send him to school for as long as his siblings. Santos comes from a big family and there were no schools nearby. As a result, from a young age, Santos learned to work the fields. As the years went by, Santos married and had his own family. Santos has three adult children who now help to work the family land; Santos' wife is a housewife. There is no electricity in Santos' community but, with a lot of effort, he bought a solar power system and installed it in his home. This has been very beneficial for all of the family. Santos now wants to apply for a loan in order to buy a battery. The battery currently in the system needs to be replaced so that the solar power system will continue to work.

loans.use: to buy a battery for his solar power system.

loans.name: German Nicolas

texts.es: German, tiene 36 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene 4 hijos y reside en el municipio de Tocoa junto a dos de sus hijos. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace 6 años estableció una pulpería para obtener ingresos para el sustento familiar, en la pulpería vende granos básicos, refrescos, churros, productos de aseo, manteca, harina, huevos, pan, café,  etc. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para ampliar una nueva línea de productos en su negocio, piensa comprar y vender teléfonos celulares. Su objetivo es ampliar su negocio con otros productos y que sus hijos lo administren.
texts.en:
German, 36, is single and has four children.  He lives in the municipality of Tocoa with two of his children.  He has always worked in commerce and six years ago established a grocery store to earn an income to support his family.  He sells basic grains, soft drinks, doughnuts, personal care products, lard, flour, eggs, bread, coffee, etc.  

He has decided to request a loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL to add a new line of business, buying and selling cell phones.  His goal is to add new products for his children to sell.

loans.use: To buy and sell cell phones.

loans.name: Malga Yoaba Group

texts.fr: Malga Yoaba est un groupe de cinq(05) femmes qui travaillent sans relâche. Ses femmes prennent le crédit à ACFIME depuis Octobre 2011 mais jusqu'ici, elle font correctement leurs remboursements. Christine, responsable du groupe est veuve, mère de sept(07) enfants et très battante. Avec la vente des condiments et légumes,Christine a pu scolariser trois(03) de ses enfants et les quatre(04) autres sont dans l'apprentissage de métier comme la mécanique, la couture.Avec ce prêt, elle pourra s'approvisionner en légumes et condiments de qualité pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Le bénéfice lui permettra de mieux s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Malga Yoaba is a group of five (05) women who work relentlessly. They joined ACFIME in October 2011 and have always repaid their loans without incident. 

Christine is the leader of this group. She is the widowed mother of seven (07) children and a very energetic person. The sale of condiments and vegetables has allowed her to send three of her children to school, while the other four are training in professions like mechanics, sewing, etc. 

She will use this loan to stock up on quality vegetables and condiments to meet customer demand. Her profits will help her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to stock up on quality vegetables to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Amway products.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 3 children and lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a rickshaw and is a rickshaw driver by profession. He wants to replace the rickshaw body as it has been damaged due to excess usage. For this purpose he needs money which he cannot afford given his income. Their only source of income comes from driving the rickshaw and their daily expenses are covered by the earnings from driving the rickshaw. Repairing their rickshaw quickly is important and urgent for them. Therefore Nazia has applied for a loan to help her husband replace the rickshaw body.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her husband's rickshaw body replacement

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is 48 years old and a mother of 6. She is a dedicated housewife always making sure that all her family's needs are met. One of her sons runs a general store in the local community. In order to provide more products to his customers, her son needs funds. Currently his income is not sufficient to cover the expenses for purchasing new stock. So in order to help her son, Khursheed has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. This loan is important for her son to gradually expand his business. Khursheed believes that this loan is a stepping stone for her son to become successful and self sufficient, and also to help his family raise their living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her son's general store

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 40 years old and a housewife. She has 4 children. Her husband is a truck driver by profession. He has been in this profession for 10 years. He is the only earning person in the family. As their income depends on driving the truck, its regular maintenance is important. Constant driving and loading and unloading stock from the truck has led to wear and tear. Due to this her husband needs money for maintenance and repair of his truck. Khalida wants to be a helping hand for her husband. That is why she has requested a loan to be able to pay for the truck's maintenance expenses. 
She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the cost of her husband's truck (vehicle) maintenance

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 36 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is married and a supportive housewife. Her husband runs a fruit shop. He has been in the fruit selling business for 10 years. As it is summer and a variety of fruits are available in the market, the demand for fruits has increased. So he wants to buy more quantity along with many other variety of fruits in order to provide more variety of fruits to his customers and increase his sales. His aim is to increase his profit margin, as he finds this increase in demand lucrative. This way he will also be able to save an amount for future purposes and also expand his business. That is why Bushra has requested a loan for the second time to help her husband increase his business. They previously repaid the loan amount on time. 
She and her husband thank Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for providing the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits for her husband's fruit selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: M.sarwar

texts.en:
M. Sarwar is a 58-year-old married person, a father of five children. He is living along with his family in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
M. Sarwar owns a clothing shop in the market; he sells fancy and high quality clothing. Some customers prove very poor and do not purchase after asking the prices of clothing. He does not compromise upon his quality and rates; he does not sell below his purchasing power but he does not like to refuse his respected customers also. To win their confidence and to avoid disappointment of worthy customers, he wants to start a low rates clothes stall on the front of his shop so that such poor customers, who do not have enough purchasing power, ultimately can buy clothing for their children and can celebrate Eid Festival.
M. Sarwar invests his savings and profit in his current business but does not have enough cash in hand to set up a new stall. 
For this purpose he requires financial support from Kiva, so he contacted the field partner BRAC Pakistan and requested a Kiva loan. In this way he can easily set up a clothing stall for the poor customers and can generate more income for cherishing his own family as well.
M. Sarwar is very delighted and thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To set up a clothing stall for poor customers

loans.name: Daniel Angel

texts.es: Daniel  es habitante de la comunidad ojo de agua  tiene 33 años de edad  es un joven luchador  dice que con el apoyo y esfuerzo de sus padres el estudio y tiene su carrera profesional de ingeniero Agrónomo, una vez que termino sus estudios  ha trabajado en diferentes instituciones, actualmente él se ha dedicado a cultivar unas manzanas de tierra que su padre le heredo  él está casado tiene  2 hijos ellos aún están pequeños no van  a la escuela ,  dice que el compro  hace un par de años  un sistema solar  ya que en la casa de sus padres así como en la comunidad no contaban con energía eléctrica  , ahora será necesario  hacer el cambio de las baterías de su  sistema solar para que este siga funcionando , es por esa razón que está haciendo el trámite de crédito .
texts.en:
Daniel lives in a community called Ojo de Agua.  He is 33 years old and is a hard-working young man who, with the support and efforts of his parents, was able to study and get an Agronomy Engineering degree.  Upon graduation he worked at different institutions.  Now he grows apples on land he inherited from his parents.  He is married and has two children who are not yet school age.  

A couple of years ago he bought a solar system because there was no electric energy in his parent's house nor in the community.  Now he must change the system batteries in order for it to work.  This is why he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: To buy two batteries for his solar system.

loans.name: Ahmad Din

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is Ahmad Din, who is 44 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He has run a general store for several years. He is the father of a daughter and four sons. One of his sons suffers from a serious disease; Ahmad Din has taken him to many specialists, but his disease still persists. He loves his son a lot and wants to see his son healed and hearty.  For this purpose, he has been spending a lot of money seeking a cure for his son. 
Ahmad Din has to generate maximum profit from his current enterprise so he can easily provide medical treatment for his son. He wants to increase the stock in his general store so that he can get maximum profit on a daily basis.
Therefore, Ahmad Din has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he will be able to buy sacks of flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.
Ahmad Din is very glad to receive this loan and is hopeful that he will successfully generate maximum income and provide better medical care for his son. 
Ahmad Din is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his general store, such as sacks of flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en: Akbari lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is 38 years old, a housewife and looks after her children. Her husband runs a salon in their community. Given his good work and five years of experience he has developed a good reputation and image in the region. His clients are satisfied with him. As it has been quite a while that he is running this business, he wants to upgrade his salon by installing new chairs and providing better services by purchasing new cosmetics. For this he requires funds that are not available to him currently. Therefore to cater for this shortage of cash his wife has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva Partner. Her husband plans to provide more services in his salon in the future as the demand for different services is increasing day by day. This way he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy new chairs and cosmetic items for her husband's salon.

loans.name: Luis Octavio

texts.es:
Luis es un trabajador hombre de 49 años de edad que sufrió por un duro golpe el cual fue perder su esposo por motivos no quiere manifestar pues le duele hablar del tema, comenzó con una pequeña tienda donde oferta productos de aseo como trapeadoras, escobas, sacudidores, recogedores, legumbrera  y productos de la canasta familiar, inicio con un local pequeño y fue creciendo poco a poco. 

Ahora está en un local más grande y su ventaja es que es el único local de ese tipo que hay en el sector de no estar a sus vecinos del alrededor les tocaría realizar largos desplazamientos para adquirir algún producto que no produzca su finca o por algún medicamento por esa razón opto por el local y mantenerlo y así ayudarse y ayudarle a sus vecinos.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar reformas locativas, comprar vitrinas, pintar y organizar un poco su local y también comprar variedad de mercancía en productos de la canasta familiar, en aseo, frutas y verduras. 

Con el crédito podrá brindar un mejor servicio y constituir un local insignia en el sector donde sus vecinos puedan comprar sus productos sin realizar desplazamientos que en ocasiones pueden ser mayores a 1 hora.
texts.en: Luis is a 49-year-old working man who suffered a hard blow when he lost his wife for reasons he doesn't want to express because it hurts him to talk about it. He opened a small shop where he offers cleaning products like mops, brooms, carpet beaters, dustpans, and vegetables and staple goods. He began with a small storefront and grew little by little. Now he is in a bigger storefront and the advantage is that it is the only storefront of its kind in the area; without his store, the neighbors would have to go very far to get any product not produced on their own farms, or for any medicine. Therefore, he opted for this storefront so he can help his neighbors. He wants to request a loan to renovate the store, buy display cases, paint, organize the store a bit, and buy a variety of staple goods products, cleaning supplies, fruits and vegetables. With the loan he will be able to provide better service and build a flagship store in the area where his neighbors can buy products without going long distances, which can sometimes be more than an hour.

loans.use: Renovate his storefront, paint, buy display cases, stock up on cleaning products like mops, brooms, dustpans; and staple goods products like fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ricardo Alfonso

texts.es: Ricardo  originario de la comunidad caña de castilla  tiene 24 años de edad logro estudiar hasta quinto  grado de primaria  después por diferentes razones  dejo los estudios y  aprendió a trabajar con su padre y sus hermanos  los labores de siembra de granos básicos   de esta manera  se ha ganado la vida es soltero vive en casa de sus padres  en su casa hace unos años atrás gozan del beneficio de tener luz porque  entre sus hermanos y el compraron un sistema solar , ahora él quiere aplicar a este crédito para así comprar una batería  ya que es necesaria cambiarla . Dice que desde que en su casa cuentan con energía la vida familiar ha mejorado ya que su madre antes tenía que madrugar a cocinar y se alumbraba con candiles  hoy en día no es así y por las noches  se quedan reunidos  después de cenar .
texts.en: Ricardo is from the community of Caña de Castilla. He is 24 years old and managed to study only until fifth grade. After that, for various reasons, he left school and learned to work with his father and his brother in sowing staple grains and learned a living that way. He is single and lives at home with his parents. Since a few years ago, they have enjoyed the benefit of electricity because he and his brothers bought a solar power system. Now he wants to use this loan to buy a battery, as it is time to change it. He says that since the house has had electricity, their family life has improved since their mother used to have to wake up early to cook by and they had to light the home with candles. Now it's not like that, and at night the family can spend time together after dinner.

loans.use: buy a battery for his solar power system

loans.name: Santos Angel

texts.es: Santos  es de la comunidad caña de castilla  tiene  55 años  dice que él ha vivido toda su vida  en esta comunidad , estudio  hasta cuarto grado de primaria en la escuela cercana de su comunidad ,  dice que en su época fueron tiempos difíciles ya que no habían muchas escuelas además  que después se dio la guerra en fin por varias razones el no puedo estudiar como hubiese querido . así que él se ha ganado siempre la vida trabajando en la agricultura de esta forma él ha sacado adelante a su esposa y sus 7 hijos  , sus hijos mayores ya se casaron y le han dado nietos  él dice  es feliz con la familia que Dios le ha dado por eso siempre él se ha esforzado por darles todo lo necesario  así que hace tres años compro un sistema solar para su vivienda ya que no hay energía convencional en la comunidad  ahora es necesario cambiar la batería del sistema por eso hará el trámite de crédito para así comprarla
texts.en:
Santos lives in the community of Caña de Castilla.  He is 55 and has lived his entire life in this community.  He has a fourth grade education and went to the near-by community school.  At that time things were difficult and there were not many schools; and later war broke out so he was unable to continue his education.  He has always worked in agriculture to support his wife and seven children.  His adult children are married and he has grandchildren.

Santos says he is happy with the family God gave him.  He has always worked hard to give them everything they needed.  Three years ago he bought a solar system for his home because there is no conventional energy in the community.  Now he needs to change the system's battery and is requesting a loan to be able to do so.

loans.use: To buy a battery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, oil, meat, and banana leaves to make her delicious dishes

loans.name: Ghulam Mustafa

texts.en:
Ghulam Mustafa is the age of 55 and living in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of three sons and three daughters. He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hard worker. He is running a small business in a nearby town to provide services in the form of running a grinding stone. He wants to help the people, which is the reason he decided to open a grinding stone shop in the society.  He speaks in a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built very good relations with his customers. His grinding stone shop is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot. He sells flour in the shop as well, so he needs wheat to get more stock of flour in shop.
 
Ghulam Mustafa is the sole earner of the family and has been providing financial support to the whole family by himself. His expenses increase day by day because his children have grown. Therefore, Ghulam Mustafa requested a loan so that he would be able to buy more stock of wheat and grind it with his grinding stone (machine). In this way, he can meet his financial requirements. 

Ghulam Mustafa hopes that the lenders will support him in the expansion of his business. He is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more wheat to grind and sell as flour

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is the age of 30, living in Lahore with her two children.
 
Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. His instruments have been wearing out and need to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments but his financial condition does not allow him to buy them.
. 
Due to his low purchasing power, Rubina has requested a Kiva loan so that her husband can be empowered and can easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, a front mirror and a revolving chair.

Rubina hopes that this loan will work positively and she will be able to save for household expenses. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, a front mirror and revolving chair.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 29 years old, married and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his three-wheeled auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his services.

Nasreen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the cost of her husband's rickshaw maintenance.

loans.name: M.sagheer

texts.en: M. Sagheer is 49 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of three sons. He owns a butcher shop in the market. He has been running his butcher shop for the last 11 years. He buys calves, cows and goats and sells meat from his shop to the customers. His number of clients has increased due to his good attitude towards his clients. Moreover, he is the sole earner of his family so he wants to increase his income. In this way, he will be able to meet his family's requirements. He is a very honest shopkeeper. He behaves politely to people. He wants to offer chicken to his customers. Therefore he wants to buy broilers, calves and goats to sell meat at his  butcher shop to improve his standard of living. For the development of his business, he needs a loan. So he contacted BRAC Pakistan who issued him a loan for his butcher shop. M.Sagheer is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy calves, goats, and broilers for his butcher shop

loans.name: Goshi

texts.en:
Goshi a 29-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a kid. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is a tailor by profession and very expert in her art. She has been sewing clothes for many years. This is the reason she has gained a lot of experience in her profession. Her sewing machine has become out of order and needs maintenance and new spare parts but she does not have sufficient cash on hand to bear the repair costs.

Therefore, Goshi has requested a loan so that she can maintain her sewing machines and buy additional material for her tailoring business. Her family has to do hard work to generate income for their huge family and she participates in providing the monthly income. Goshi is very thankful for Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair cost of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, vive en unión libre con su pareja y reside en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. Paulino siempre se ha dedicado al  cultivo de maíz y frijol y hace 8 años ha cultivado café lo que le genera mayor ingreso. Esta producción la vende en pergamino oro en la misma zona. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 4,000 lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de abono, foliar y pago de mano de obra para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café. Su plan es poder aumentar un cuarto de manzana de cultivo de café para aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Paulino is 36 and has 4 children. He lives with his common-law wife in a village in the township of Taulabe, Comayagua. Paulino has always worked growing maize and beans, and he has grown coffee for 8 years, which has increased his income. He sells his produce as green coffee beans in the same area.

Paulino is requesting his third loan of 4,000 HNL to invest in buying manure and foliar fertiliser as well as to pay labourers to maintain his coffee farm. His plan is to be able to increase his 1/4-manzana [Central American unit of land] of coffee plantation in order to increase his income and help his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and foliar fertiliser and to pay for labour to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.es: Melvin, tiene 51 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos en el municipio de San José, Comayagua. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos. Lleva 10 años cultivando café en sus propias parcelas. Esta producción de café la ofrece en pergamino a los intermediarios de la zona. Don Melvin a solicitado varios prestamos para mantener estable sus cultivos, actualmente solicita el quinto ciclo que es por  11,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y dar asistencia al cultivo de café. Su objetivo es lograr la compra de una manzana de tierra para sembrar mas café y que su hijos tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Melvin, 51, is married and has three children. He lives with his family in the municipality of San José, Comayagua. He has been growing grains his whole life. He has been growing coffee for ten years in the land he owns. He sells it in parchment [dried, but unhulled] to local intermediaries.

Melvin has requested several loans to maintain his plantations in good shape. He is now requesting his fifth loan: 10,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy fertilizers and perform maintenance on his plantations. His goal is to be able to buy a piece of land to grow more coffee and make sure his children have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and perform maintenance on his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 53-year-old woman living with her two children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Parveen’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and paying a daily fare because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and cherishes his children even in his old age. Now his children are growing older and their needs are as well. He was worried for many days about how to avoid a daily fare, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Parveen has been saving to buy new auto rickshaw, but at the time of purchasing some money remains short. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  She hopes that soon he will not need to pay a daily fare which will cause an increase in income. 

She is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 53-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has few years of experience in this field. Her son assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. 

She wants to grow her business so that she has requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy general store items such as flour, sugar, rice, salt, etc.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 34-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband's spare parts shop. He owns a spare parts shop in which he sells motor bike spare parts such as silencers, fuel tanks, foot rests, wheels, tyres, tubes, etc.

He supplies the spare parts to other shop keepers as well. The spare parts shop is single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to know that he is in need to grow his business so that he could easily cope with the future expenses.
 
Therefore, Zahida has requested a Kiva loan to help her husband. She hopes that he will succeed in his future planning and this loan will prove beneficial for his business.

loans.use: to buy more auto spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child. She sells charcoal at the market on both a retail and wholesale basis. She gets additional income from operating a restaurant at the market on retail basis. She serves all kind of people in her restaurant. Margaret has been in this business for the last 15 years. She takes care of additional family members, and she works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 3,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal, bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice, cooking oil and serving utensils. 

Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of buying a fridge and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, cooking oil, rice, and serving utensils, along with charcoal

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn Thái Sơn Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh has a store that sells soap, cakes, sweets, and soft drinks. Oanh has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is not being able to meet the high demand for products/services.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, cakes, sweets, and soft drinks to sell.

Oanh is 40 years old, and she is married with three children. Oanh is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn Thái Sơn xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2008,  Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  Oanh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit,  Oanh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, cakes, sweets, and soft drinks

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 42-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She has requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. He has been selling vegetables for many years; he sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four-wheeled manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash on hand to buy the initial inventories to run his shop well. 

His children are young and growing, and their needs as well.  To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, Munawar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy initial inventories in the form of fresh vegetables for her husband's newly opened vegetable shop.

loans.name: Waqas Ahmad

texts.en:
Waqas Ahmad is 34; he is a young and energetic person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of a daughter and living nearby his cloth shop. This cloth shop is the only source of income for his family and this is the reason he devotes  all his time and energy to the shop. 

His shop is situated in the clothing market and there are a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price. This competition becomes the cause of low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, prices and delightful colors of cloth in his shop so that he can maintain the rate of turnover.

Now the major problem is that the Eid festival is about to come and he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy cloth according to the taste and demand of customers. If he can not purchase the cloth as per the choice of his customers, then his sales might be highly affected. He does not want to reduce his sales and monthly income as well.

Therefore, Waqas Ahmad has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can be empowered to buy the cloth.
 
Waqas Ahmad hopes that he will purchase cloth according to his desire at the right time so he can cope with the market competition and grow his income as well. He thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: To buy cloth of various designs, colors and the latest fashion for reselling.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and five children; some of them are still attending school. She has worked in the agricultural field since 2010, and owns land where she cultivates different types of products. Her husband is a baker, and they contribute together to be able to meet the life needs.
