Presently, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase required products, such as seeds and fertilizer, so she can increase her productivity and therefore her revenue. 

Samia aims to grow her business as her only wish is to keep improving her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase required products such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Khelcom 2" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Khelcom 2 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La présidente s’appelle Ndoucka, elle s’active dans la transformation de poisson frais en poisson séché ; cela fait plus de 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle en tire des bénéfices et en appui son mari dans les charges de la maison.
Ndoucka souhaite acheter des fours pour les louer à ses sœurs qui travaillent dans le même domaine.
texts.en: The Khelcom 2 Group is a subgroup of a network of female processors of fish products. The group consists of five women who have been active for a few years. They regrouped to benefit from financial assistance that enables them to strengthen their income-generating activities. Ndoucka is the president. She runs a business turning fresh fish into dried fish. She has been in business for over 10 years. She earns a profit and helps her husband with the household expenses. Ndoucka wishes to buy ovens to loan to her sisters who work in the same industry.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Omar Segundo

texts.es:
El señor Omar es un ingenioso trabajador de la calle el cual trabajo como empleado muchos años pero por recomendación de una amiga que le dijo que vendiera peto, pero es una bebida típica de la región que es caliente hecha a base de maíz, leche y harina.  

Sale en un particular vehículo que el mismo fabrico con su olla a vender su apetecida bebida por todo el sector con alegría y sonrisas por doquier.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de otra carreta, una olla grande e insumos (harina, maíz, leche). Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá empelar otra persona y distribuir en más zonas y generar un empleo. 

Es padre de 2 hijos de 2, 7 años de edad y gracias a su profesión ha podido salir adelante con ellos y aspira a generar más empleo llenar toda la región de distribuidores de “peto” y ser una empresa sostenible en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Omar is an ingenious person who works as a street vendor. He was employed for many years, but a friend told him to start selling “peto” [a traditional food, also called “mazamorra”], which is served hot and is made of corn, milk and flour. He sells his product (which is very popular) on a vehicle he designed, which carries a big pot. Omar is always in a good mood and smiling.

Omar is requesting a loan to buy another cart, a big pot and ingredients (flour, corn and milk). With this loan, he will be able to create a job position. He will hire someone to help him cover a wider area.

He has two children aged 2 and 7. Thanks to his job, he has been able to get ahead. He hopes to be able to employ more people and cover the whole region with more “peto” distributors. He hopes to have an enduring business.

loans.use: to buy a cart, a pot and ingredients to prepare "peto" (milk, flour and corn).

loans.name: Wadad

texts.en:
Wadad is a 44-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and four children. Her husband is an aluminum worker and he represents the main income source of the family. As for her, in order to increase the family’s income, she started to work as a farmer in 2012. 

Today, Wadad is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase fertilizers and seeds as she intends to grow more produce. Wadad states that she is in real need of improving her work as she badly wants to enhance the family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZANADOUGOU un village dans la commune de KOLOKOBA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame MAMOU MADOU débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The 10 members of the Benkadi 1 Group are married women with an average age of 41. They have an average of 5 children and mostly live  in traditional families in Zanadougou, a village in the commune or Kolokoba, in the area of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Ms. Mamou Madou, the person standing second from the right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg bags of fertilizer, 1 container of herbicide, and to pay for the labor cost of maintaining 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the output will be sold at the village level in Sikasso to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit. She expects to earn an average profit of 74,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and the interest, as well as help her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: M.saeed

texts.en:
M. Saeed is 44, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hard-working and gentle person. 

He is a butcher by profession; he sells chicken out of a shop as he owns a butcher shop in the market. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell them in his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which lowered his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. He has been running this shop for the last ten years. He covers his household necessities from his own shop as well. He speaks in an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His butcher shop is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. His number of customers increases day by day. 

Therefore, M. Saeed requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy more broilers to sell in his shop. In this way he would be able to cope with demand. He dreams of providing all facilities of life to his children. M. Saeed is tension free after taking this loan because BRAC showed him a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more broilers for his chicken shop

loans.name: Libardo Antonio

texts.es:
Don libardo es un artesano de tradición el cual adquirió sus conocimientos pro sus padres, en general su familia ha realizado esta actividad pro muchos años. Tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7, 6 años de edad que depende exclusivamente de él. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para seguir realizando sus artesanías y seguir con la tradición que le ha dado de comer toda su vida, se enfrente con grandes inconvenientes como lo son la baja demanda de artesanías en el mercado y la principal es que para conseguir sus insumos tiene que viajar a otro municipio.

Solicita un crédito para poder ir a otro municipio y comprar en grandes cantidades caña flecha, tinte natural.

Gracias al crédito podrá desplazarse y comprar los insumos necesarios para seguir con su profesión. 

Solo pide un voto de confianza pues es lo único que sabe hacer y no quiere que se acabe una tradición de familias artesanas.
texts.en:
Libardo is a traditional craftsman who acquired his knowledge from his parents.  In general, his family has done this work for many years.  He has 3 children, ages 9, 7, and 6, who depend exclusively on him. 

He wants to apply for a loan to continue making his crafts and continue with the tradition that has given him food all of his life.  He confronts great inconveniences such as the low demand for crafts in the market and, principally, that in order to get his supplies, he has to go to another municipality.

He requests this loan to be able to go to the other municipality and purchase a large quantity of wild cane (caña flecha) and natural dyes.

Thanks to the loan, he will be able to go there and purchase the necessary supplies to continue with his profession.

He only asks for a vote of confidence since it is the only thing he knows how to do and he doesn't want a family tradition of craft-making to end.

loans.use: to purchase wild cane (caña flecha) and natural dyes and money to travel since these supplies are not found in his municipality.

loans.name: Kotognogontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKODENI un village dans la commune de KOLOKOBA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur KALIFA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme KOTOGNOGONTALA 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The four members of the Kotognogontala 1 Group are married men with an average age of 37. They have an average of 5 children and mostly live  in traditional families in Kolokodeni, a village in the commune or Kolokoba, in the area of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. They work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Mr. Kalifa, the person standing second from the right in the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy eight 50-kg bags of fertilizer, 10 containers of herbicide, and to pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of land. After the harvest, the output will be sold at the village level in Sikasso to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit. He expects to earn an average profit of 160,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and the interest, as well as contribute to his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past three years, Betty has been working hard to manage her small local brew business. 

To help expand her  business, Betty has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy millet that will be used for making the local drink, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Betty hopes that in the future she  will be able to start a poultry farm. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy millet that will be used for making local brew

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es: Juana de 56 años de edad es separada. El grupo “Mujeres Forjadoras” está conformada por 06 socias emprendedoras y visionarias. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como azúcar y arroz. Actualmente viene creciendo en su negocio gracias a su continua dedicación y por el buen servicio que facilita a sus clientes. Solicito el crédito para la compra de  harina, azúcar, arroz y aceite. El deseo de Juana es contar con más variedades de productos como cereales (frejoles y lentejas) en su tienda. El grupo “Mujeres Forjadoras” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Juana    es la  segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo amarillo.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Forjadoras" group has six enterprising and visionary members. One member is 56-year-old Juana, who is separated. She makes a living selling groceries such as sugar and rice. She has been expanding her business thanks to her continued dedication and the good service that helps her clients. Juana is applying for this loan in order to buy flour, sugar, rice and oil. Juana's wish to have more stock, such as cereals (beans and lentils) in her shop.

The "Mujeres Forjardoras" is grateful to Kiva investors for making this loan possible. In the photo, Juana is the second on the left; she is wearing a yellow t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, rice and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Avon and Zermat cosmetics.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
Cornelio es un padre de familia dedicado, tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Desde hace más de 15 años está separado de la madre de sus hijos y solo ha tenido que buscar la manera de sacar a su familia adelante, con el trabajo y la responsabilidad del cuidado de la familia. Ha sido difícil pero gracias a su empeño y dedicación lo consiguió. Es una persona admirable, todo un ejemplo a seguir. Actualmente trabaja como Maestro de Obras en el rubro de construcción y le va muy bien porque poco a poco ha sabido ganarse el respeto de las personas con las que trabaja.
Cornelio está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar materiales (madera) para su trabajo, de esta manera evitará accidentes al momento de cumplir su labor. Gracias a esto seguirá luchando día a día para poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en: Cornelio is a dedicated father.  He is 59 years old, has 2 adult children, and lives in Ica with his family.  For more than 15 years, he has been separated from his children's mother and alone has had to look for a way to get his family ahead with work and the responsibility of his family's care.  It has been difficult but thanks to his tenacity and dedication, he has done it. He is an admirable person, a model to follow. He currently works as a construction foreman and it is going very well for him because, little by little, he has known how to gain the respect of the people with whom he works. Cornelio is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help that they have offered him, he will be able to purchase materials (lumber) for his work, and in this way will avoid accidents at the time to do the work. Thanks to this, he will continue fighting day by day to be able to offer his family a better future.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp and energy-saving jikos

loans.name: Noel Soliz

texts.es:
Noel se ha trazado una meta a 2 años y es adquirir su propia parcela de cultivo, y poder comenzar con la construcción de una finca no es tarea nada fácil y requiere de mucho tiempo pero todo sueño comienza con algo.

Noel es agricultor hace 10 años ayudado por su esposa su fiel y leal compañera que ha luchado con el mil y un batallas más contra el clima, contra la pobreza, contras las adversidades en general. Tiene 3 hijos y gracias a su producción pueden alimentarlos y darles la oportunidad de que estudien. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos para mantener su cultivos pues las plagas y los constantes cambios climáticos han afectado, pero tiene un problema y es que estos insumos tiene un precio elevado por eso requiere una ayuda a prestamista que lo apoyen en su micro-empresa para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas, abonos y riegos para mantener sus cultivos libres de plagas y muy saludables.
texts.en:
Noel has outlined his two-year-goal and it is to buy his own plot of land for growing crops and to start building a his own farm. This will not be an easy task and will take a long time but every dream has to start somewhere.

Noel has been a farmer for ten years. He has been supported by his faithful and loyal partner and together the couple has fought 1001 battles against the climate, poverty and other adversities. The couple has three children and, thanks to their farming work, they can feed them and give them the chance of an education.

Noel wants to apply for a loan in order to buy supplies to look after his crops. Disease and constant climate change has affected the crops but Noel has another problem: the cost of farming supplies is very high. As a result Noel needs a loan from those who can support his business. The loan will be used to buy fertilisers, anti-pest chemicals, fungicides, anti-insect chemicals, manure and irrigation equipment in order to keep his crops healthy and free from diseases.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, anti-pest chemicals, fungicides, anti-insect chemicals, manure and irrigation equipment in order to keep his crops healthy and free from diseases.

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en:
Awatef is a 44-year-old Lebanese widow who lives with her eight children. After her husband’s death, she became the sole person who is financially responsible for her family. 

Undoubtedly, Awatef works very hard as a farmer to provide her family with the minimum needs of life. Her only aim is to ensure that she earns enough income to continue supporting her children. 

Today, Awatef is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase needed products such as seeds and manure to strengthen her business operations. In the future, Awatef confirms that she will request additional Kiva loans for more improvements.

loans.use: to purchase needed products such as seeds and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an electric mill, Carve (which is a soy meat replacement that is vegetarian) and meat.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles es un padre de familia dedicado, tiene 2 maravillosos hijos, 35 año de edad y vive en San Martin junto a su familia. Es una persona muy emprendedora. Desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar en la chacra porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron pagarle una carrera universitaria. Sin embargo, con todas las ganas del mundo luchó día a día para poder apoyar a su familia. Ahora que tiene su propia familia su mayor objetivo en la vida son sus hijos, trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor educación y que ellos puedan estudiar y ser profesionales. Desde hace muchísimos años se dedica a la agricultura, siendo el cacao el principal producto cultivado, le va muy bien debido a los años de experiencia que tiene y porque siempre se preocupa por ofrecer productos de calidad a los clientes.
Aquiles está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes y plaguicidas para mantenimiento de sus cultivos. De esta manera podrá tener productos de mejor calidad y obtendrá mayores ganancias. Gracias a ello más adelante podrá concretar una de sus principales metas: "Ampliar sus cultivos y sacar a su familia adelante".
texts.en:
Aquiles is a dedicated father to two marvellous children. Aquiles himself is 35 years old and lives in San Martin with his family. He is very enterprising. He had to work in the fields from a young age as his parents were very poor and could not pay for him to study at university. Nevertheless, Aquiles has fought with all the enthusiasm in the world in order to support his family He now has his own family and his biggest concern in life is his children. Aquiles works a lot in order to give them a better education and send them to university. For many years Aquiles has worked in farming, with his main crop being cacao. The work is going very well as Aquiles has many years' experience and because he always worries about giving his customers the highest quality products.

Aquiles is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy supplies such as anti-disease treatments and fertilisers to look after his crops. This will give Aquiles higher-quality products and he will earn higher profits. Thanks to this, in the future he will be able to achieve on of his biggest goals of expanding his crops and helping his family to prosper.

loans.use: to buy supplies for looking after his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetable such as lulo, apple, tree tomato, potato, carrots, cilantro, onion, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She sells sugar cane at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Joyce takes care of additional family members. She works six days a week. 

Joyce has requested a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy a truck load of sugar cane. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to buy a delivery van for her transportation needs. 

Joyce lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a truck load of sugarcane.

loans.name: Somos Progreso Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Somos Progreso” La cual  está constituida por 10 socios progresistas y responsables. Rosa de 44 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir. Así mismo como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de gas. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a ha logrado salir adelante, donde así Ella puede distribuir sus productos al por mayor a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es abarcar su negocio a provincias. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra telas, hilos y botones. La Alcancía “Somos Progreso” agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible dicho crédito. Rosa es la segunda del lado izquierdo,  viste chompa marrón y polo floreado.
texts.en: This is the "Somos Progreso" bank, which is comprised of 10 progressive and responsible members. Rosa, 44 years old, is separated with 2 dependent children. She works sewing clothing. Also, as a second job, she sells gas. With much effort and dedication, she has managed to get ahead, to a point where she can distribute her products in bulk to her customers. Her greatest dream is to establish her business in the provinces.  For this reason, she asks for a loan to purchase fabric, thread, and buttons. The "Somos Progresso" bank thanks all of the people who have made this loan possible. Rosa is the second from the left, she wears a brown sweater and flowered shirt.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe LA PAIX  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à  ATT BOUGOU un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame DJOUMA debout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes LA PAIX, fait la vente  de friperie.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 balles de friperie au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group "La Paix" ("Peace") are married women with an average age of 45 years and an average of 5 children each. The women live mostly in traditional families in Att Bougou, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

The women are on their sixth group loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better meet the needs of their customers. 

Djouma is pictured standing in the second position from right to left in the photo. In the group of women in La Paix, Djouma sells used clothing. She plans to use her loan to purchase 2 bundles of used clothing from the big market, to resell them at retail in the market to a customer base made up of men and women for both cash and credit. 

Djouma is much sought after by her customers because of the quality of her products. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 31,000 francs CFA, a portion of which she will use to pay back the loan and interest, and the rest of which she will put into savings.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his space, and have working capital to invest in corn.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha: Es una mujer trabajadora, originaria de Waspam, tiene 49 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos: 3 son mayores de edad y un adolescente que estudia su primaria. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna desde hace 5 años con gran esfuerzo le ha venido realizando mejoras a su vivienda. Solicita este financiamiento para viajar a Managua, con el objetivo de realizarse análisis médicos debido a que no ha estado estable de salud en los últimos meses.  Su sueño es establecer  una agencia de perfumes, en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas.
texts.en: Martha, 49, is a hardworking woman from Waspam. She is a single mother of 4 children; 3 are adults and  one is a teenager studying in primary school. Through great effort, she has been making improvements to her home so that she and her family can live safely and with dignity. She is applying  for this loan to travel to Managua to have medical tests, since her health has not been good for the last several months. Her dream is to establish a perfume store in the town of Puerto Cabezas.

loans.use: to travel to Managua to have medical tests.

loans.name: Alvaro Manuel

texts.es:
Álvaro como a muchos campesinos es un hombre que tiene muchos problemas en el campo tanto, económicos, ambientales y a eso se le suma un gran problema de que están por un proceso de legalizar sus parcelas para poder trabajar. 

Ya que no puede trabajar sus tierras se dedica a la venta de pescado y zapatos, actividades que aprendió empíricamente y como necesidad pues debe traer recursos a su hogar, tiene que mantener a su mujer y dos hijos de 8 y11 años de edad que aún están en etapa de crecimiento y depende 100% de Álvaro. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de pescado y zapatos con lo que podrás ir caminando de vereda en vereda ofertando sus productos con la esperanza de que le compren para ayudar en su hogar y que su familia no pase pro necesidades. 

Sueña con poder legalizar sus parcelas y darle un futuro prometedor a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Álvaro, like many rural people, is a man who has many problems in the countryside, such as economic and environmental, and this is summed up in a huge problem that they are in the process of legalizing the title of his land to be able to work it.  

Since he can't work his land, he works selling fish and shoes, jobs that he learned empirically and as a necessity since he had to bring resources to the home; he has to support his wife and two children, ages 8 and 11, who are still growing and depend 100% on Álvaro. 

He wants to ask for a loan to purchase fish and shoes with which he can walk from village to village offering his products with the hope that they buy them to help his household and that his family doesn't lack necessities.

He dreams of being able to legalize the title to his land and to give a promising future to his two children.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shoes to sell in the different areas.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à FLAZAMBOUGOU une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame SAFIATOU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group Benkadi 1 are married women with an average age of 43 years and who have an average of 5 children each. They live for the most part in traditional families in Flazambougou, a community in the Sikasso area in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

The women partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their seventh group farming loan with the organization, with their previous loans all having been fully repaid.

Safiatou, pictured standing in the second position from left to right in the photo, is in the business of growing peanuts. With her loan, Safiatou plans to purchase 2 bags of 50kg of fertilizer, one barrel of herbicide, and to pay the labor costs to maintain .5 hectares. 

After the harvest, Safiatou will sell her crop at the village level in Sikasso to a cusotmer base made up of both men and women, for both cash and credit. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 74,000 francs CFA per crop. This income will allow her to pay back her loan and the interest, and to help her husband with the daily family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina de 50 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
En  actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y cumplir sueños y metas como cualquier persona.  Carolina tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos como: perfumes, crema, hidratantes, labiales, sombras de ojos, rubor, lápiz de ojos, desmaquilladoras, en su casa de habitación y por encargo. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Carolina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Carolina, 50 years old, married with two young children, is originally from Leon, a place which is located in the western area of the country. She is hard-working and responsible, with desires to improve herself. Sadly, for lack of economic resources, she couldn't study for a degree and had to work from a young age, to help with the household expenses. 

Currently, she fights day by day to offer her children a better future and to realize her dreams and goals like any other person. Carolina works selling cosmetics such as perfumes, creams, moisturizers, lipsticks, eye shadows, blush, eye liner, and make-up remover in her house and by advance order. She works in her business about eight hours every day offering her products, so that in the not so distant future she will be able to increase her income.  Carolina is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business in the purchase and sale of cosmetic products such as perfumes, creams, moisturizers, eye shadows, blush, eye liner, and make-up remover.

loans.name: Dunia Elizabeth

texts.es: Dunia, tiene 50 años de edad, no tiene hijos, vive con su esposo en el Municipio de Yoro. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, vende mercadería como joyas de oro, plata y enchape, zapatos, sandalias, lociones y cosméticos. Este  negocio lo tiene hace 14 años, vende en su casa y de forma ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es por 25,000 lempiras, este  lo invertirá en la compra de joyas de plata, anillos, aretes, cadenas, pulseras, para vender y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Con este préstamo va poder comprar de contado, y obtener mejores precios y podrá ganar más. Su meta es mover rápido el inventario para pagar el préstamo con solvencia y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dunia is 50 years old. She does not have children. She lives with her husband in the Yoro municipality. She has always made a living from commerce. She sells merchandise like gold, silver, and plated jewelry, shoes, sandals, lotions, and cosmetics. She has had this business for 14 years. She sells from her home and on foot. 

The loan that she is requesting is for 25,000 Lempiras. She will invest this in the purchase of silver jewelry, rings, earrings, chains, and bracelets to sell and complete her customers’ orders. With this loan, she will be able to make her purchase with cash to obtain better prices and be able to make more money. Her goal is to move her inventory quickly to pay the loan with solvency and make better profits.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewelry, rings, earrings, chains, and bracelets to sell.

loans.name: Yeisson Andres

texts.es:
Yeisón es un hombre que encontró en la cocina su gran pasión hace un mes inicio con su proyecto de vender productos alimenticios y hoy da las gracias de encontrar a una entidad que le preste y confíen en él y en su negocio. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una estufa, mesas y silletería para ofrecer un buen servicio a los clientes y tener algo muy parecido a un restaurante. 

De momento atiende solo el local, pero quiere generar empleo y confía en el sabor de sus platos que gusten y pide por favor que apoyen su negocio y le colaboren en la consolidación de este pues quiere trasmitir en sus platos la pasión y el amor que tiene por esta profesión.
texts.en:
Yeisón is a man who found his passion in the kitchen. A month ago, he initiated his project of selling food products, and today he is grateful for having found an entity that can provide him with a loan and trust him and his business.

He wants to take out a loan to buy a stove, tables and chairs to offer a new service to his clients and have something resembling a restaurant.

Thus far he only tends to the one location, but he wants to generate business and trusts in the flavor of his dishes. He asks that you support his business and collaborate in gathering the loan, as he wants to transmit in his dishes the passion and love he feels for this profession.

loans.use: buy a stove, chair and tables for his food business.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and four go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and medication.

Victo is a tailor. She operates her business from a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 the years. She gets additional income from selling piped water and rental houses. She works six days a week. Victo has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy materials for making clothes. Her major challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy an electric sewing machine and build more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 24, sells sandals (market vendor) in Hoima, Uganda. She works four days a week and twelve hours a day. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children, ages four and five, and both attend school. Mary hopes to buy her own plot of land and build.

Bad weather, which leads to poor roads, hinders her business and sometimes she gets stuck on the way and ends up not serving her clients. Mary is acquiring credit to buy more sandals to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sandals to sell.

loans.name: Paula Del Socorro

texts.es: Paula del Socorro, mayor de edad madre soltera de tres hijos los cuales son mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal, por falta de recursos económicos en su hogar no logra terminar sus estudios, pero esto no fue obstáculo para incursionar en el negocio dedicándose a la venta de cosméticos como: shampoo, perfumes, cremas, lápiz de ojos, lápiz labial, crema hidratantes, rubor, mascarillas, tintes, crema alisadoras, entre otros, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito, los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal sus compras son tambien al contado y al crédito, inicia su negocio con fondos propios productos de sus trabajos anteriores, negocio el cual tiene ya ocho años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, su rutina diaria empieza desde muy temprano el cual le dedica unas 9 horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería de forma ambulante a sus clientes fijos y eventuales,el cual lo desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida  y la de sus hijos, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su inventario en la compra de cosméticos como: bases, cremas de cuerpo, crema faciales, anti arrugas, anti ojeras, desmaquilladores, mascarillas, vanidad, blus, pintura de labios, punturas de uñas,  entre otros.
texts.en: Paula del Socorro, is an older single mother of three children who are adults, originally from Chinandega municipality, located in the west of the country. She is a hard-working, responsible woman with desires to improve herself. For lack of economic resources in her home she was not able to finish her schooling, but this was not an obstacle to enter into her business selling cosmetics such as shampoo, perfumes, creams, eye liner, lipstick, moisturizers, blush, mascara, dyes, and straightening cream, among others. Her sales are made on credit, which she collects weekly and biweekly. Her purchases are also made in cash and on credit. She started her business with her own funds, a product of her previous work, and she has been working for eight years in this business. Her daily routine begins very early, and she works 9 hours daily offering her merchandise as a street vendor to regular and occasional customers, which she does with great desire since it has been her way of life and that of her children. One of her dreams is to be able to grow her business a lot; the goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and supply her inventory in the purchase of cosmetics such as bases, body creams, facial creams, anti-wrinkle creams, creams for circles under the eyes, make-up removers, mascara, blush, lipstick, and nail polish, among others.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products such as straightening cream, anti-wrinkle cream, mascara, lipstick, fingernail polish, dyes, among other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of electronics items like cables, DVDs and televisions, radios and switches.

loans.name: Madiha

texts.en:
Madiha is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. She got involved in the agricultural field in 2011 and works in collaboration with her husband, who also works as a blacksmith to handle the heavy life expenses.  

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase grains and fertilizers to produce more goods. Madiha looks forward to borrowing more Kiva loans in the coming days as her wish is to own a vegetable shop.

loans.use: purchase grains and fertilizers

loans.name: Christ Is Everything Group

texts.en:
From Accra, six people are part of Christ is Everything group. The people are focused to transform their lives through empowerment, small loans and education. They have a vision of raising their standard of living and creating a more prosperous future for themselves and their families.

Ruth is a married member of this group. She is a 49-year-old and sell bags and shoes. Ruth wants to continue to support her four children's education. She buys bags and shoes at wholesale price and sells to customers. Ruth is requesting a loan to diversify her merchandise with new designs and colors.

She always learns something new and useful through ID-Ghana's program which enhances members' lives and businesses. Members of this group know how to read or write and so the educational training sessions are essential to their success as caretakers of their family members and business entrepreneurs. The training is given in the indigenous language of the women, often with pictures, and covers a variety of subjects including effective business management practices, nutritional and health tools, and self-esteem.

loans.use: To buy bags and shoes at wholesale and sell to customers.

loans.name: Bitaldino

texts.es: Don Bitaldino, tiene 59 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Cofradía, Cortes. Siempre ha sido agricultor, El cuenta con una propiedad donde se ha dedicado al cultivo de piña.  Esta producción la vende en la misma zona o intermediarios. Esta solicitando un tercer ciclo de préstamo por 28,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de abonos para fertilizar el cultivo de piña, con la esperanza de aumentar la producción. Su sueño es ser un productor mayorista.
texts.en: Bitaldino is 59 years old. He is single and lives with his family in a town in the municipality of Cofradía, Cortes. He has always been a farmer. He has property where he grows pineapples. He sells what he produces in the same area or to intermediaries. He is in his third cycle and asking for a loan of 28,000 lempiras. He will invest it in buying fertilizer to grow pineapples in order to increase his yield. His dream is to be wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow pineapples.

loans.name: Alh. Salisu

texts.en: Alh. Salisu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Alh. Salisu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Zubairu, Suwaiba, and  Abdulrahaman. Alh. Salisu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Alh. Salisu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Alh. Salisu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Alh. Salisu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Valentina Reyna

texts.es:
Valentina es una joven soltera, tiene 21 años de edad y vive en Chimbote junto a su familia.
Es una persona emprendedora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria debido a los escasos recursos de sus padres, y para ayudar a su familia tuvo que buscar un trabajo. Como es una persona muy talentosa e innovadora con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo ahorrar dinero para dedicarse al negocio de venta de calzados para dama, le va muy bien porque ha ganado experiencia, es trabajadora y siempre se preocupa de brindar productos de calidad a los clientes y una atención personalizada.
Valentina tiene pensado comprar mercadería con el crédito para de esta manera poder implementar el negocio, con esto ella podrá generar mayores ingresos y poco a poco ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella quiere agradecer a los prestamistas Kiva por todo el apoyo que le han brindado, porque gracias a ello más adelante podrá cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: "Terminar de construir su casa".
texts.en:
Valentina is a single young woman. She is 21 years old and lives in Chimbote with her family. She is an enterprising woman who really wants to get ahead. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to go to college due to her parents' low income and to help her family she had to find a job. Since she is a talented and innovative person, with a lot of effort and dedication she was able to save money to have a business selling women's shoes. It is going very well for her because she has gained experience, she is hard working, and because she is always concerned with offering quality products to her customers, as well as personalized attention. 

Valentina is planning on buying merchandise with the loan so that she can outfit her business. With it, she will be able to generate more income and little by little improve her family's quality of life. She wants to thank the Kiva lenders for all of their support, because thanks to them in the future she will be able to achieve one of her biggest dreams: finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to outfit her shoe selling business.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
La razón de todo negocio son sus clientes y esto lo entiende muy bien Juan camilo que quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de repuestos de motocicletas para siempre estar preparado para cualquier eventualidad que se presente en su negocio y brindar un servicio oportuno y rápido. 

Su intención con el crédito es poder tener a la mano material de trabajo, sueña con tener un local más amplio y empleados y disfrutar de su pasión las motos por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Customers are the reason for every business and Juan Camilo understands this very well. That is why he wants to ask for a loan to buy motorcycle replacement parts to always be ready for anything that comes up in his business and offer a timely and rapid service.

With the loan, he intends to buy work material to have on hand. He dreams of having a bigger locale and employees and enjoying his passion of motorcycles for a long time.

loans.use: to buy materials to have on hand for things that are needed daily.

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en: Buhari is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Buhari joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children. Buhari is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Buhari will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Buhari can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Buhari is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en: Anas remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Anas, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Anas  is ambitious and is aiming to reap more than 30 bags per hectare this season.  “Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are well educated and have professional jobs” expressed Anas.  With this loan, Anas is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Habibu

texts.en: Habibu is a Babban Gona member from Auchan. Habibu expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Habibu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Habibu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Habibu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Habibu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Habibu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her business and to purchase supplies such as meat, beans, potatoes, cheese, arepas, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Hassan

Hassan is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Hassan will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a 30-year-old farmer from Ang/Jaki.  As a Babban Gona member, Gloria is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Gloria can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Gloria is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Gloria is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children: Sadiq,  Ibrahim,  and  Bilkisu. Gloria’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, she said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa: Es mujer luchadora, madre soltera de 5 hijos.  Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura, digna y reducir el hacinamiento, desde hace 3 años con gran esfuerzo ha venido realizando mejoras a su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción. Clavos, zinc, madera rustica y cepillada, postes de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra para construir un anexo. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a tenacious woman.  She is the single mother of five children.  Three years ago she made a great effort and has been making improvements to her house.  She did this in order to live safely, decently, and to reduce the overcrowding.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials like nails, metal sheeting, planed and rough wood, wood posts,  and to cover the labor costs to build an extension to her house.  

Her dream is to provide her family with a house with adequate conditions.

loans.use: to buy nails, metal sheeting, planed and rough wood, wood posts,  and to cover the labor costs to build an extension to her house.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, tiene 36 años de edad, esta en una relación de unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara.  Ella se dedica la venta de ropa nueva y usada, para damas caballeros y niños y también vende churros, arroz, jabón, harina, pan y dulces. Este  negocio lo tiene desde hace 6 años en su casa y vende de forma ambulante. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de quesos. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el octavo ciclo y es por 12,000 lempiras, para la compra de ropa como ser camisas, blusas, pantalones, camiseta y ropa de niños, su propósito es tener más variedad de ropa para vender y con las ganancias piensa hacerle mejoras a su vivienda y vender calzado.
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 36, is in a common-law marriage, and she and her life partner have two children.  She lives in a village in the Quimistán municipality.  She sells new and used clothes for women, men, and children.  She also sells churros, rice, ham, flour, bread, and candy.

She has had this business in her house for six years, and she sells in an itinerant manner.  She previously sold cheese.

The loan she has requested is her eighth cycle, and it is for 12,000 lempiras.  The loan is to buy clothes like shirts, blouses, pants, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.  Her intention is to have a greater variety of clothes to sell.  With the profits she plans to improve her house and to sell shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothes like shirts, blouses, pants, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Samaila Iliya

texts.en: Samaila Iliya is a 41-year-old farmer from Jaki.  As a Babban Gona member, Samaila Iliya is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Samaila Iliya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Samaila Iliya is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Samaila Iliya is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children. Samaila Iliya’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a 32-year-old farmer from Ang/Dantani.  As a Babban Gona member, Abigail , is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abigail can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Abigail is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give her access to the high quality inputs that she needs. When asked how she plans to use the money that she makes from selling her produce at the end of the season, Abigail said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Ruth, Naomi, and  Orpha. "Ultimately,  I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito La Paz, este grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad y amistad, siempre se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante, en cada reunión se turnan para realizar comida y compartir con todas sus compañeras. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió y de varios lugares hermosos donde se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza, fue proclamada ciudad patrimonio de la humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999 gracias a la belleza de su arquitectura, su gente es amable y gentil.

Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y ayuda económicamente. La casa en la que vive es propia.
La Señora Rosa se dedica al comercio informal, vende una gran variedad de productos como vinchas de cabello, ropa interior y mas, también teje carteras que las vende a sus amistades, este trabajo le dio la oportunidad de ver a sus hijos crecer y apoyarles en todo lo que necesitan ya que es su propio jefe y cuenta con las ganancias diarias de su trabajo.
Esta repitiendo el crédito porque quiere invertir en la compra de ropa interior y carteras para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a kind and gentle member of the La Paz communal bank.  She likes the communal bank for its solidarity and friendship.  They always help each other to get ahead.  At each meeting they take turns making food and sharing it with all of their colleagues.

She lives in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its cold climate and its various beautiful places where nature can be enjoyed.  It was declared a World Heritage Site in December of 1999 thanks to its beautiful architecture and its kind and gentle people.

She is 50 years old and the single mother of three grown children.  Two of them are married and live independently.  Her single son works and helps financially.  The house she lives in is her own.

Rosa works in informal commerce.  She sells a great variety of products like hair accessories, underwear, and more.  She also weaves handbags that she sells to her friends.  This work gave her the opportunity to see her children grow and to support them with everything they need.  This is because she is her own boss, and she has the daily income from her work.

She is repeating the loan because she wants to invest in buying underwear and handbags in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: To buy underwear and handbags.

loans.name: Manahel

texts.en:
Manahel is a 20-year-old Lebanese single woman. In 2011, she started to work as a private teacher, receiving students at her home. She assists in covering her family’s everyday expenditure. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a laptop. She notes that this laptop will be used to better manage her work preparations. She is very positive about her future and states that she will apply for more Kiva loans in the days to come.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman who has two children attending school. 

Five years ago, she started to work as a private teacher at her home. She has prepared a room at her house and equipped it with needed tutoring supplies to welcome students and educate them properly. 

Currently, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a wide variety of books, special editions that will help her improve her teaching skills. Hilda is an optimistic person who seeks to start working in a school appropriately with this coming school season.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of books.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, hair relaxer and cigarettes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Victoria, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Victoria is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, expressed Victoria.  With this loan, Victoria is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Zapaniah

texts.en: Zapaniah is a Babban Gona farmer from Kargo. Zapaniah expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Zapaniah to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Zapaniah can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Zapaniah, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Zapaniah will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Zapaniah will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is a 30-year-old farmer from Kargo.  As a Babban Gona member, Hajara, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hajara can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Hajara is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Hajara is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children; Alheri,  and  Asabe. Hajara’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and two children go to school. 

She operates a salon business from the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for nine years on a retail basis. She takes care of additional family members. 

She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling soft drinks. She has requested for a loan from MCDT- SACCO of 900,000 Uganda shillings to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, rollers, and treatments. 

Her major challenge is electricity blackouts that hinder her work. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her salon into a bridal salon. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, and treatments

loans.name: Alh. Ibrahim

texts.en: Alh. Ibrahim is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Alh. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Nazifi, Sale, and  Mahammadu. Alh. Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Alh. Ibrahim will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Alh. Ibrahim can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Alh. Ibrahim is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Yunusa A.

With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

texts.en: Hudu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Hudu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Muazu, Ali, and  Bello.
