loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is a widowed mother of four. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication, and school fees.

For the past four years,  Pamela has been selling local brew at the market seven days a week. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 700,000 to buy spirits, crates of beer and jerrycans of local brew.  

Pamela's goal is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy spirits, crates of beer and jerrycans of local brew.

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул 32 года, замужем, двое детей. У Бурул среднее образование, с 2005 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 18 овец и 8 телят, также есть земельный надел, где она выращивает клевер и кукурузу, реализуя свою продукцию оптовым покупателям, а также торгуя углем на местном рынке. Бурул известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят с целью дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Burul is 32 years old, married, with two children. She has secondary education. Since 2005 she has been doing farmwork as a supplementary source of income. Her farm includes four cows, 18 sheep and eight calves. She also has a land plot where she grows clever and corn, selling her produce to wholesaler. She also sells charcoal at the local market. Burul is known as a principled, honest, decent and reliable person. At present her business brings in a monthly revenue in the amount of 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Burul turned to the Bai Tushum and Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy calves for later resale. Burul plans to use the resulting revenue for a further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening and resale in order to invest in further growth of her business.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children who both go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

She sells chips, chapatti and fried cassava at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling charcoal. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO of UGX 1,100,000 to buy a jerrycan of cooking oil, a tray of eggs, baking flour, and bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include high taxes that are charged by the revenue authority.

loans.use: to buy a jerrycan of cooking oil, a tray of eggs, baking flour, and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Sahabi, Hashimu, and  Usaina. Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ibrahim will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ibrahim can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Ibrahim is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
No hay edad para convertirse en un ser humano emprendedor.  Las necesidades de la vida nos abren nuevos espacios para poder desarrollarnos como ser humanos y tener una vida digna, es el caso de Lorenzo que vive en su comunidad soltero de 23 años de edad y tiene un hijo por quien esta decidido a luchar para darle un futuro mejor y dejarle una condición de vida agradable y mejor a la que el tuvo que vivir.

La actividad que el realiza en su comunidad es la compra y venta de abarrotería, trabajo que los ha venido haciendo desde hace mas de 5 años ya que por medio de ello el puede tener un ingreso económico y obtener ganancias para poder sostener a su familia e brindarle una buena educación a su hijo porque el quiere que su hijo sea un gran profesional en la vida y en todos los campos de la vida.

El uso respectivo que el le dará el préstamo es para la compra de un terreno que le están ofreciendo en su comunidad y dicha oportunidad el no desea desaprovechar porque desde hace un tiempo el a querido comprar un terreno para el futuro de su hijo. Entre las metas de Lorenzo es la construcción de casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan una condición de vida apropiada para vivir y que sean hombres profesionales en todos los campos laborales.
texts.en:
There is not an age at which one becomes an entrepreneur. The needs of life open spaces so that we can develop as humans and have a dignified life. This is so in Lorenzo's case. He lives in his community, is single, is 23 years old, and has a son for whom he is dedicated to fighting to ensure that he has a better future and better quality of life than Lorenzo had.

The business that he runs in his community is the purchase and sale of groceries, which he has been doing for the past 5 years. Through this activity, he has been able to earn income and money in order to support his family and provide a good education for his son. He wants his son to be a great professional in every area of his life.

He will use the loan to purchase land that is for sale in his community. He does not want to waste this opportunity because he has wanted to buy land for a long time for his son's future. One of Lorenzo's goals is to build a home for his son so that he will have good living conditions and so that he will be a working professional.

loans.use: to purchase land in his community.

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en:
Khadijeh is a 53-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. 

A year ago, she started to produce homemade food, which she sells to people from her community. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she states that she will buy ingredients needed to produce a bigger quantity of provisions. 

Khadijeh’s wish is to open a small snack shop, and that’s what she wants to achieve after receiving this loan and other loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar and flour to expand his business.

loans.name: Las Cruces Group

texts.es:
Los pueblos son privilegiados cuando hay manos femeninas detrás de cualquier producción, los esposos se sienten muy apoyados por esposas así, que se dedican además de los quehaceres domésticos también se dedican a realizar actividades que les genera una ganancia.

Aleyda es casada de 22 años de edad, está embarazada durante 6 meses y tiene un hijo de un año y media es el motivo que lo a motivado a realizar actividades en su comunidad donde ella vive para tener un ingreso económico para el sustento de su familia ya que los ingresos de su esposo no les favorece para tener una vida digna. (Aleyda es la que tiene puesta una falda de color negro)

A la actividad que ella se dedica es a la venta de refacciones granizadas porque para ella es una fuente importante de ingresos para poder sustentar a su familia y en un futuro darles educación a sus hijos para que ellos lleguen a profesionales.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará el préstamo es para la ampliación de su negocio para así obtener más ganancias en el futuro. En su comunidad lo aprecian mucho y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han decidido a iniciar sus negocios junto con ella para que sus familias también tengan beneficios económicos para una mejor condición de vida.

Una de las metas de doña Aleyda es ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos  económicos de igual manera para tener una condición de vida adecuada en su familia.
texts.en:
Villages are lucky when there are female hands behind businesses. Husbands feel supported by their wives who, in addition to performing domestic tasks, also work to provide income.

Aleyda is 22 years old, is married, is 6 months pregnant, and also has a one-year-old son. Her children are her motivation to work in her community so that she can earn money to support her family, since her husband's income does not allow them to have a decent life. (Aleyda is the one in the black skirt).

Aleyda works by selling icy refreshments, which is an important source of income for her so that she can support her family and provide an education for her children so that they can become professionals.

She will use the loan to expand her business so that she can earn more money in the future. She is very well-respected in her community, and it is because of her than a group of women have decided to start their businesses with her, so that their families can also earn more money to have a better quality of life.

One of Aleyda's goals is to help her husband with finances so that they can have adequate living conditions for their family.

loans.use: to sell refreshments.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is an experienced farmer from the village Tsaghkaber, Lori region, Armenia. She lives with her two children (her husband is a migrant worker), and she is engaged in breeding livestock of cows and hens, as well as in the cultivation of wheat, potatoes, barley, grass, plums, apples and pears. Farming is the only source of the family’s income. 

Karine currently wants to enlarge the livestock a little bit to be able to meet her family's increasing daily needs. A loan of $2,000 (USD) will be a great support to this hard-working woman and will enable her to purchase a cow and forage for the livestock. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately hasn't been able to repay it. However, thanks to her hard work, Karine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, Karine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Karine will be very thankful to all the lenders for helping them develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for livestock

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives with her only son in Malishka village of Vayots Dzor region, Armenia. For the past three years, Ruzanna has been running a small store. She trades there with general food products and has good operational skills. Her son helps her to run the store and earn income for their living expenses. 

Ruzanna has requested this loan of 3,000 (USD) to be able to purchase new supplies (food, candy, soft drinks) for the store. Please help this hardworking woman to develop her business.

loans.use: to pay for new supplies (food, candy, soft drinks) for the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of spare part items such as engine oil, break oil, light fans, and plug and wheel nuts for resale

loans.name: Khelcom 3" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Khelcom 3 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La présidente, madame Amy, elle s’active dans la transformation et le commerce de poissons et de fruits de mer. Elle fait de la transformation de ces produits destinés à la vente. Amy est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Grâce au crédit, elle peut améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Amy souhaite voir son capital augmenté afin d’augmenter sa capacité d’offre pour satisfaire la demande.
texts.en: The Khelcom 3 borrowers’ group is a subgroup of a network of women processing fish products. The group is composed of five women who have been in business for some years and joined forces in order to benefit from financial support allowing them to strengthen their businesses. The group’s leader, Mrs. Amy, processes and sells fish and seafood  for resale. Amy is married and the mother of three. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her family’s nutrition. Amy would like to see her capital grow in order to increase her sales volume and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fish and seafood for processing and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture for his home.

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en:
Stephene is a married man and has one child who attends school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Stephene has operated a farming business for the past six years. His potential clients are neighbours and passersby. He dreams of expanding to a large scale farm in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, Stephene wants to purchase more seedlings and herbicides to kill pests. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and herbicides to kill pests

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en: Ummaru is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ummaru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Kasimu, Habibu, and  Aisha. Ummaru is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ummaru will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ummaru can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Ummaru is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.name: Danjuma

texts.en: Danjuma is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Danjuma joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Umaru, Murtala, and  Ayuba. Danjuma is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Danjuma will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Danjuma can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Danjuma is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a 35-year-old farmer from Bargi.  As a Babban Gona member, Shehu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Shehu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Shehu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Zakari, and  Yusufa. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à FLAZAMBOUGOU une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame WARIMATOU débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of group Benkadi 2 are married women. They are on average 39 years old with five children, and most live in traditional families in Flazambougou, a Sikasso circle town, in Mali’s third administrative region.

They collaborate with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to conduct their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their seventh loan with Soro Yiriwaso; previous loans were paid back without issues.

The species cultivated by Mrs. Warimatou is ground nuts; she is standing in second position from right to left in the photo of this women’s group, Benkadi 2. With her loan, she is plans to purchase two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and to pay the plowing fee for the cultivation of 1.5 acres.

After the harvest, the production is sold locally in the village of Sikasso, to a mixed-gender clientele paying cash or credit.

Mrs. Warimatou forecasts an average profit of 74,000 CFA for each cycle; this will allow her to reimburse her loan with its interests, and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Dinael Sebastian

texts.es:
Dinael de 24 años de edad joven que no se da por vencido sino que toma todas las situaciones de la vida como un reto hacia el futuro para poder superarse, el motivo por la cual el necesita otro préstamo es para ampliar mas su negocio de ferretería con que ahora cuanta gracias al préstamo anterior lo ha podido lograr.

El nos sabia como era la forma de cómo obtener un préstamo pero gracias a personas que le informaron de cómo sacar un préstamo y las condicione que el mismo requería el se animo a realizar su préstamo para emprender su negocio con que ahora cuento instalada en su comunidad.

La inversión en el nuevo préstamo que el está realizando es para ampliar mas su negocio de ferretería ya que el no se conforma con lo poco que el tiene sino que va por mas para llegar a tener un negocio aun mas grande.

Gracias al crédito anterior el a podido avanzar y desarrollado en la vida pero el no está conforme con lo poco que tiene sino que quiere ampliar mas su negocio.

Las metas de don Dinael y su familia es la compra de otro local para la ampliación del negocio para que su familia tengan las condiciones de vida edecuada.
texts.en:
Dinael is a 24-year-old young man who has not been defeated by situations in life, but has instead viewed them as challenges to overcome. For this reason, he requires another loan to expand his hardware store, which he was able to open with the help of a previous loan.

He did not know how to take out a loan, but thanks to people who told him how, he was able to obtain a loan to start his business, which is now open in his community.

He will use the new loan to expand his hardware store since the little that he has is not enough. He needs more to make his business even larger.

Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to advance and develop his life but he needs more in order to expand his business.

Dinael and his family's goals include purchasing another location to expand his business so that they can have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more products for his hardware store.

loans.name: Margarita Johanna

texts.es:
La Señora Margarita es una socia muy alegre que forma parte del grupo de crédito San Pablo, grupo que le gusta mucho por la solidaridad, siempre se apoyan en toda necesidad, los créditos le ayudan a crecer en el negocio, le gusta su grupo también porque en cada reunión salen de su rutina diaria del trabajo y platican de varios temas con sus compañeras. Vive por las afuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy conocida por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza y de momentos familiares.

La Señora Margarita tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos de 8, 5 y 3 años, dos de sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Margarita se dedica al trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, el mismo que es la venta ambulante de frutas y verduras, con este trabajo ha ido poco a poco mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar, es un trabajo que le da la libertad para cuidar de su familia, así como también cuenta con dinero a diario. 
Esta repitiendo el crédito porque necesita comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa, así como también frutas de temporada para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita is a very happy partner of ours who makes up part of the San Pablo credit group. She likes this group a lot because of its solidarity; they always help each other with every need, and the loans help her to grow her business. She also likes her group because in every meeting they take a break from the daily work routine and she talks about various things with her partners. She lives in the outskirts of Cuenca; this city is very well-known for its architectural beauty, which has earned it the title of World Heritage Site. There are many places to enjoy nature and time with family members.

Mrs. Margarita is 24 years old. She is married, and from the fruit of her union she has conceived 3 children; they are 8, 5 and 3 years old. Two of her children study in the local school; her husband works as a private employee and the home they live in is their own. Margarita devotes herself to the work that she learned from her parents: she sells fruits and vegetables, and with this work she has improved the economic stability of her home little by little. It is work that gives her the freedom to care for her family, and also provides her with daily money.

She is repeating the loan because she needs to buy construction materials to improve her house as well as seasonal fruits for her business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and fruit.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly: Es un señora amable, tiene 47 años de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 8 trabaja en el Mar con los buzos, capturando langosta y mariscos para venderlos a precios accesibles a las empresas distribuidoras del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para pagar planilla a sus trabajadores. Su sueño es incrementar el inventario de mariscos.
texts.en:
Nelly is a friendly, 47-year-old woman. She began working with the sea divers 8 years ago with the goal of earning her own income. She captures lobster and shellfish and sells them at affordable prices to distributors in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.

She requests her second loan to pay her employees. Her dream is to increase her inventory of shellfish.

loans.use: to pay her employees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a room.

loans.name: Valentin Felix

texts.es:
Valentin es un padre de familia dedicado, tiene 31 años, 1 maravilloso hijo quien es el mejor regalo que ha podido tener en la vida y una esposa que le brinda su apoyo incondicional, vive en Ingenio junto a su familia.
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprarse un pequeño terreno y actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, siendo la tuna su principal producto ofertado. Le va muy bien gracias a sus años de experiencia, y a que siempre se esmera por brindar productos de excelente calidad.
Valentin tiene pensado utilizar el crédito para poder comprar insumos como fertilizantes, plaguicidas y realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos hasta la etapa de la cosecha para así poder obtener productos de mejor calidad. Valentin está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por todo el apoyo que le han brindado porque con esto él más adelante podrá cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: "Comprarse un vehículo para transportar la mercadería".
texts.en:
Valentin is a dedicated father, is 31 years old, and has one son, who is the greatest gift that he could have in life. He is married and his wife provides her unconditional support. He lives in Ingenio with his family. 

With great effort and dedication, he was able to purchase a small parcel of land and he currently works in agriculture. Prickly pear is his main crop. It is going very well thanks to his years of experience and he always takes great pains to provide high-quality products.

Valentin would like to use the loan to purchase supplies like fertilizers and pesticides, and maintain his crops until the end of the harvest so that he can obtain high-quality products.

Valentin is very grateful to Kiva lenders for all of the support that they have provided because, in the future, he hopes to be able to achieve one of his greatest dreams: "to purchase a vehicle to transport his merchandise".

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  1 Group

Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAI SOGODOGOLA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame BIBA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  KOTOGNOGONTALA 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

They collaborate with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to conduct their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their sixth loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso; previous loans were paid back without issue.

The species cultivated by Mrs. Biba is rice; she is standing in second position from right to left in the photo of this women’s group, Kotognogontala 1. With her loan, she plans to purchase three 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, three cans of herbicide, and to pay the plowing fee for the cultivation of 2 acres.

After the harvest, the production is sold locally in the village of Sikasso, to a mixed-gender clientele that pays cash or credit.

Mrs. Biba forecasts an average profit of 105,000 CFA for each cycle; this will allow her to reimburse her loan and its interests, and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay plowing fees

The species cultivated by Mrs. Nachitan, a.k.a. Chata, is rice; she is standing in first position from right to left in the photo of this women’s group, Kotognogontala 2. With her loan, she plans to purchase three 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, three cans of herbicide, and to pay the plowing fee for the cultivation of 2 acres.

After the harvest, the production is sold locally in the village of Sikasso, to a mixed-gender clientele that pays cash or credit.

Mrs. Nachitan forecasts an average profit of 105,000 CFA for each cycle; this will allow her to reimburse her loan and its interests, and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds clothing material for resale

loans.name: Khelcom 10" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Khelcom 10 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Madame Maguette est la responsable, elle s’active dans la transformation de poisson frais en poisson fumé et séché. Chaque jour, elle achète du poisson frais, des herbes et du sel pour cette activité, avec l’appui du financement, elle pourra augmenter la quantité de sa production. Grâce aux revenus de son activité, elle peut donner un coup de main à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
Elle souhaite un jour acheter une pirogue et chercher des gens pour aller chercher le poisson eux même, cela maximiserai son profit et créerai des emplois.
texts.en:
Khelcom 10 loan group is a subgroup in a network of women who process fish products. Khelcom 10 is composed of five women who have been active for several years; they came together to benefit from the necessary financial support to strengthen their revenue-generating activities.

Mrs. Maguette is the group’s leader; she is in the business of processing fresh fish by smoking and drying it. Every day, she purchases fresh fish, herbs, and salt for her business. With help from her loan, she will be able to increase the amount she produces.

Thanks to her business revenues, she can help with managing daily expenses. One day, she wants to purchase a pirogue and hire people to go get the fish themselves. This would maximize her profits and create jobs.

loans.use: buy fresh fish to process and resell.

loans.name: María Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es una socia muy alegre que forma parte del grupo de crédito San Pablo, grupo que le gusta mucho por la solidaridad, siempre se apoyan en toda necesidad, los créditos le ayudan a crecer su negocio, le gusta su grupo también porque en cada reunión salen de su rutina diaria del trabajo y platican de varios temas con sus compañeras. Vive por las afuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy conocida por la belleza arquitectónica la misma que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza y de momentos familiares.
La Señora María tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña María desde muy joven se dedica a la lavar ropa ajena así como también a la agricultura y crianza de animales, estas actividades le han permitido salir adelante y brindares a sus hijos un mejor porvenir. 
Esta repitiendo el crédito porque quiere  comprar cerdos y alimento para animales.
texts.en:
Señora María  is a very happy member of the San Pablo credit group. She likes the group for the solidarity, they always support her needs, and the loans help her grow her business. She also enjoys the group because at each meeting she gets to leave her daily routine of work and talk about various topics with her friends. She lives outside of the city of Cuenca. This city is well known for the architectural beauty that gained its recognition as a Cultural Heritage Site. There are several places to enjoy nature and family time.

Señora María  is 58 years old, married and they have six adult children who are married and live independently. Her husband works as a bricklayer, and they own the house they live in.

Doña María has made a living washing clothes since a very young age. She also engages in agriculture and animal husbandry, these activities have allowed them to get ahead and to provide a better future for their children.

She is applying for a repeat loand because she wants to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is  a mother of seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

Rosemary has operated a coconut vending business for the past three years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Rosemary dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market. She sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She gets additional income from operating a kiosk from home. She works for seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT- SACCO of Uganda shilling 600,000 to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs which increase the operational costs. Her goal and inspiration is to build a permanent business premises .She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married and has five children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Vardeni

texts.en:
Vardeni lives in Gladzor village of Vayots Dzor region. She has been running a farm for nine years.  Her husband and son help Vardeni to take care of the farm and earn income for living. The requested loan of USD 3000 is very important for this family to purchase two oxen, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation. 
The family hopes for lenders' goodwill and support. They hope to have a big and profitable farm in the future and work hard to make that dream to come true.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells used shoes at the market. She sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. She gets additional income from farming. She works for seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO of Uganda shilling 500,000 to buy a bale of used shoes. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs which increase the operational costs. Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business premises. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a divorced woman from Vayk village, Vayots Dzor region. She is a mother of three daughters and she has been engaged in beekeeping for eight years. Anna keeps 20 colonies of bees and gets high quality honey and sells it in local markets. She works hard to earn income and provide her daughters with appropriate living conditions. 

The requested loan of USD 1,500 will be a big support for Anna to enlarge her beekeeping business. She will use the loan to purchase eight colonies of bees and sugar as a forage for bees. Please support Anna with her loan.

loans.use: to pay for eight colonies of bees and sugar as a forage for bees.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAI SOGODOGOLA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame MOUSOKOURA assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  KOTOGNOGONTALA 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 4 group are married women who on average are 37 years old with three children. They live for the most part in traditional families in Kai Sogodogola, a village in the Loulouni commune, in the Sikasso circle in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their agricultural affairs during the winter.
This is their sixth rural loan from the micro-finance institution, the previous loans were correctly repaid.
The crop that Mrs. Mousokoura grows is rice. She is sitting second from left in the photo of the women from the Kotognogontala 4 group.
With her loan she plans to buy three sacks of 50 kg of fertiliser, three cans of weed killer, and to pay for labour costs for the upkeep of 0.75 hectares.
After the harvest, she sells the production in the village and in Sikasso to a mixed clientele for cash and for credit. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 105 000 francs CFA per field. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and the interest and to help her husband with the daily expenses for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, weed killer, and to pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a fourth time borrower of the institution applying for 5,000,000 UGX. He is a married man with three children and mainly depends on income from his wholesale shop. He says it UGAFODE’s loans that have helped him see his business expand. Cosmas is a very hardworking man, but has got a few challenges; the main one being lack of a permanent home where he can stay with his family and also at times not being able to pay his children’s tuition on time.

To solve the problem of renting a place to stay with his family, he opted for a bigger loan amount than before, so that he can purchase a piece of land and also start putting a simple house on it. His future hope is seeing his family have a permanent home, and also educating his children up to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rubber bowls, pans, and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Emeriane

texts.en: Emeriane is 43 years old and has one child 17 years old. She has been selling foodstuffs for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more merchandise for her supermarket such as cooking oils, breads and beverages to sell. The profit from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, bread and beverages to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has four children. all of whom go to school. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She takes care of additional family members. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water .She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge includes transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to build rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expense includes food and rent.

loans.use: To buy  bags of charcoal

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en: Barbra lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school. She sells used clothes at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She takes care of additional family members. She gets additional income from poultry farming. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge includes defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking oil and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more wax cotton material for resale.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julian esta casado tiene un hijo y vive en la comunidad de Arajllanga en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Julian se gana la vida como agricultor y necesita comprar ganado para mejorar sus ingresos Julian recibe ayuda de su esposa pero no dinero por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Julian is married with one child and lives in the community of Arajllanga in a house made of adobe that he owns.

Julian earns a living as a farmer and needs to buy livestock to improve his income. He does receive help from his wife, but not money, and therefore needs your help.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Tacien

texts.en: Tacien is 55 years old. He is married with 7 children aged  between  22 and 2 years old. Five of them go to school and 2 of them are still young. He is a farmer and he has been working for one year. With the loan, he would like to buy more woods and timbers for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to pay the school  fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy woods and timber for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has six children, three of whom go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells chips at the market in the evening. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works for seven days a week. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 to buy cooking oil, a bag of Irish potatoes, spices and cabbages. Her major challenge includes high costs of cooking oil and Irish potatoes. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, a bag of Irish potatoes, and cabbages

loans.name: Vilma Leticia

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 36 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive en el distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque - Perú, la poblacion de este distrito se dedica a la siembra de yuca, maíz y arroz estos productos son comercializados en diferentes caserios y pueblos vecinos.

Vilma se dedica al comercio de animales de corral pero también al engorde de ganado hace varios años atrás; solicita préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para incrementar su negocio y hacer arreglos en el corral donde criá a sus animales, lo que generara mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old, she is married, and has two dependent children. She lives in the district of Nueva Arica, in the province of Chiclayo in Lambayeque Region – Peru. The population of this district grows cassava, corn and rice. These products are sold in markets in local hamlets and villages.

Vilma makes a living selling small farm animals, but she also started fattening cattle several years ago. She is requesting a loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to increase her business and make arrangements at the corral where she breeds her animals, which will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to invest in herbusiness by buying guinea pigs, chickens, ducks and increase her sales.

loans.name: Mapendo Tukuyu Group

texts.en:
Emanuel, who is in his early thirties, is single with no children.  He has been running a grocery store for six months now.  He works from 7:00 am to 12:00 am daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Emanuel's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use his loan to restock the out of stock items in the grocery store.  He dreams of opening a bigger grocery, like a supermarket.

Emanuel will share this loan with his loan group, Mapendo Tukuyu, which has ten members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the grocery store.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has one child. She has one additional family member. She sells chips at the market in the evening. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works for seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT- SACCO of Uganda shillings 200,000 to buy cooking oil, a bag of Irish potatoes, spices and cabbages. Her major challenge includes high costs of cooking oil and Irish potatoes. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and spices

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en: Felicien is aged 55 years. He is married with 2 children, aged between 18 and 22 years. One of them goes to school. He has been selling foodstuffs for the past 2 years. With the loan, he would like to buy land for farming so that he can cultivate more foodstuffs for sale such as beans, cassava and peas. The profit from the business will be used to buy more to reinvest in the same business of farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming for a huge output.

loans.name: Rachid

texts.en: Rachid is aged 39 years old. He is married. He has been selling foodstuffs for the past 5 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cassava, sorghum and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, sorghum and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is 48 years old. She is married with 6 children, aged between 10 and 28. Three of them go to school. Her husband is a driver. She has had a bar for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beers and sodas for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of beers and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for building a drainage system for his crops.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is aged 43 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 6 months and 20 years. Four of them go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs such as beans and maize for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay the school fees of the children.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is aged 29 years old. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 3 and 8. All of them go to school. Her husband is a businessman. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize, rice and sorghum for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy more maize, rice and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Joserine

texts.en: Joserine is 50 years old. She is married with 7 children aged between 15 and 30. All of them go to school. Her husband is in business. She has been selling sorghum and beans for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and beans for sale. The profit from the business will be used to buy more domestic animals such as cows to provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Peacock Group

texts.en:
Helena, who is in her late thirties, is married and has two sons and two daughters who are in school. For two years, Helena has been managing a business of clothes and cosmetics. She works from 9 a.m. until 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her fourth loan request via Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, to buy clothes and cosmetics stock. Helena received an extra income, which she used to cover household expenses and school fees and she also plowed back to her business so as to grow it. Helena will use this loan to buy a tailoring machine and ladies clothes to resell. She dreams to become a successful businesswoman.

Helena will share this loan with her loan group,"Peacock," which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and ladies clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Eduardo

texts.es:
Oscar, se mantiene trabajando en el campo cultivando maíz, maicillo, pipián y ajonjolí, se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar de mano de obra, de esta manera preparara el terreno para sembrar y seguir generando ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos.
Oscar ha sabido administrar los créditos para tener un negocio que le dé estabilidad económica para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Oscar continues working in the field growing corn, sorghum, pipián squash and sesame seeds. He decided to apply for a new loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to prepare the fields for planting and continue to generate revenue to meet their commitments.

Oscar has been able to manage the loans to have a business that gives economic stability to meet the basic needs of their families and pay their debts.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to prepare the fields for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax-printed cotton fabric for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lambs to raise and resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Lidis

texts.es: Lidis, mujer de 49 años que habita en la población de Soledad, con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 7 a 30 años,con quienes llegó a este municipio producto del desplazamiento forzado de su región natal. Ella empezó vendiendo minutos de celulares de una amiga y poco a poco con un pequeño capital inició su propia aventura de negocios, con la principal meta de sacar a su familia adelante, aprovechando que el estado nacional de Colombia le apoyó con el otorgamiento de vivienda gratis, lugar donde se siente satisfecha y trabaja duramente para continuar creciendo personalmente familiarmente y en su negocio, en el que hoy no solo ofrece servicios de llamadas y recargas telefónicas, sino también vende mercancía variada como ropa, accesorios etc. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará camisas, suéteres, calzado, accesorios para celulares etc. Con esta inversión mejorará las condiciones de su negocio pues el incremento de sus inventarios impacta a sus antiguos y nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Lidis is a 49 year old woman who lives in the town of Soledad, with her husband and five children from 7 to 30 years of age. They came to this municipality as a result of forced displacement from their home region. Lidis began selling minutes on the cell phones of a friend and little by little, with her small capital, she began her own business venture. 

Her principal goal is to help her family get ahead, taking advantage of the assistance of the national government of Colombia in the form of a free dwelling. She feels happy in this place and she works hard to continue growing personally, in her family and in her business, which today not only offers services of phone calls and recharging of phones, but also the sale of a variety of  merchandise such as clothing, accessories, and so on. At present, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she will be arranging at the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and which she will use to buy shirts, sweaters, footware, cell phone accessories, and so on. With this investment, Lidis will improve the conditions of her business, since an increase in her inventory will impact her both her former and new clients.

loans.use: to buy shirts, sweaters, footware and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, pork, flour, propane, etc., to make tortillas and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Andonassoumana 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe ANDONASSOUMANA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à TOLA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame BINTOU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  ANDONASSOUMANA 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Andonassoumana 1 group are married women who on average are 41 years old with four children. They live for the most part in traditional families in Tola, a village in the Sikasso circle in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-financial institution in order to manage their agricultural affairs during the winter.
This is their fifth rural loan from the micro-finance institution, the previous loans were correctly repaid.
The crop that Mrs. Bintou grows is rice. She is sitting second from the left in the photo of the women from the Andonassoumana 1 group.
With her loan she plans to buy two sacks of 50 kg of fertiliser, one can of weed killer, and to pay for labour costs for the upkeep of 0.5 hectares.
After the harvest, she sells the production in the village, in Sikasso to a mixed clientele for cash and for credit.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 74 000 francs CFA per field.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and the interest, and to help her husband with the daily expenses for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser, weed killer and to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Cesar Carlos

texts.es:
German tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el Caserio Pampa Colorada que pertenece al Distrito de Pomahuaca un pueblo de clima caluroso y tranquiilo que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios como transportista, realizando esta actividad desde hace 2 años, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peon agricola ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para invertir en arreglos a su mobilidad y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
German is 25 years old. He lives in the Pampa Colorada Village that belongs to the Pomahuaca District, a town with a hot and tranquil climate. They make a living from agriculture, commerce, and livestock breeding. It is situated in the Jaen Province that belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He provides services as a transporter. He has performed this activity for 2 years. Additionally, he makes a living providing services as a farm hand. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 800 Nuevo Soles to invest in repairs to his vehicle and in this way make an additional income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in repairs for his vehicle, with which he will make a higher income and so be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is married with four children. She is 67 years old and lives in Sebac, Tudela,Philippines. Isabel sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities. Isabel has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en: Marie Claire is aged 40 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 11 and 17. All of them go to school. She has been selling clothes for 10 years. With the loan, she will be become a wholesaler in the future. The profit from the business will be used to renovate their house.

loans.use: to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.name: Santana Israel

texts.es:
Santana es un hombre de 53 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica. Esta viudo desde hace 12 años y no volvió a tener pareja.  Con su compañera de vida que fue su esposa tuvieron en común 4 hijos,  de ellos solo dos viven con él,  los otros dos son hogares aparte. Los dos que viven con él uno se dedica a la agricultura y la hija a los oficios domésticos.

Santana se dedica a la agricultura, hace  esta labor desde que es joven, un tío le  enseño hacerlo  y a ganarse la vida de esa forma, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad ya que no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia. Otra actividad económica que él tiene es el de jornalero  remunerado. El lugar de trabajo está a unos 4 kilómetros de su casa los cuales recorre a pie, a veces en bicicleta y a veces en carro, lo que más le cuesta es hacer llegar los insumos necesarios para cultivar, pues está en una zona bastante aislada por lo que se le dificulta. Su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una yunta de bueyes para surcar la tierra donde sembrara, esto le servirá ya que no cuenta con esa herramienta tan importante para desarrollar su trabajo. Actualmente, tiene que arrendar los bovinos si quiere sembrar y le implica más gasto. El préstamo le ayudara a tener una herramienta que es indispensable para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.

Los sueños del cliente son un poner su propio negocio de venta de maíz y frijol, ya que actualmente  no lo tiene.
texts.en:
Santana is a 53 year old man, with 6th grade elementary education. He is a widower and has four children, of whom only two live with him, the other have homes of their own.  Of the two that live with him, one is in agriculture and his daughter is a domestic worker.
Santana works in agriculture, has worked in this activity from a very young age, his uncle showed him how to earn a living from this activity, he decided to work on this because he couldn’t find another way to help his family.

Another economic activity that he has is that he is a paid journeyman. His place of work is four kilometers away from home, which he commutes to by walking, sometimes in a bicycle or in a car. It’s really hard for him to get the necessary inputs he needs for agriculture, as this area is far away, which is why it’s difficult.  His work schedule is 6 hours a day.

He is requesting a loan to CREDICAMPO to buy a yoke for cattle to work the soil where he will seed, this will be very useful as he currently doesn’t have this very important equipment needed for his work.  Currently, he needs to rent the yoke and cattle if he wants to seed which translates into a cost.  The loan will help him obtain a piece of equipment that is essential for the production of corn and beans.

The dreams of this client are to start his own business of selling corn and beans which he currently doesn’t have.

loans.use: to buy a yoke for cattle to work the soil where he will seed, this will be very useful as he currently doesn’t have this very important equipment needed for his work.  Currently, he needs to rent the yoke and cattle if he wants to seed which translates into a cost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his medical treatment costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover the treatment and medicine for his mother.

loans.name: Rupinta

texts.en: Rupinta is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing. She requested a loan to pay for labor costs of house renovation. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that Rupinta has been given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs of house renovation.

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Monica es una madre de familia de 3 maravillosos niños, tiene 28 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Su familia es su mayor motivación en la vida, es por ellos que lucha día a día para poder brindarles todas las comodidades que ella no pudo tener por falta de ingresos económicos en su cada. Actualmente trabaja como Obrera de Campo en un Fundo Agrícola y le va muy bien debido a su excelente desempeño y a que es muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Monica piensa utilizar el crédito para poder pintarrajear su vivienda. De esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y su familia se sentirá más cómoda en el hogar. Ella quiere dar las gracias a los prestamistas Kiva por todo el apoyo que le han brindado, ya que con esto Monica seguirá laborando con el mismo entusiasmo de siempre para más adelante poder concretar una de sus metas: "Tener su propio negocio":
texts.en:
Monica is a mother of three wonderful children, she is 28 years old and lives in Ica with her family.   Her family is her biggest motivation in life, it’s for them that she fights day after day to be able to give them the comfort that she wasn’t able to enjoy due to the absence of financial resources at her house.  She currently works as a rural journeywoman at an Agricultural Fund and she does well because of her excellent work and for being a hard and entrepreneurial worker. 
Monica is going to use the loan to paint her home.  This way she will be able to improve her quality of life and her family will feel more comfortable at home.  She wants to thank the lenders of Kiva for all the support provided, with the loan Monica will continue to work with the same enthusiasm to later on achieve another goal: “start her own business”.

loans.use: Renovations to home (paint the walls)

loans.name: Diesebyl

texts.en: Diesebyl is 37 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF to buy piglets, feed and vitamins. Diesebyl has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of fish (ndagala) for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a car.

loans.name: Andonassoumana 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe ANDONASSOUMANA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à TOLA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame OUMOU débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  ANDONASSOUMANA 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Andonassoumana 2 group are married women who are on average 39 years old with four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Tola, a village in the Sikasso circle in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their farming affairs during the winter.
This is their fifth farming loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, the previous loans have been repaid.
Mrs. Oumo grows rice. She is standing first on the left in this photo of the women from the Andonassoumana 2 group.
With her loan, she plans to buy two sacks of 50 kg of fertiliser, one can of weed killer, and pay the labour costs for the upkeep of 0.5 hectares.
After the harvest she sells the production in the village to a mixed clientele for cash or for credit.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 74 000 francs CFA per field.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and the interest, and help her husband with the daily expenses for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and weed killer, and to pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en: Levy is 44 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Levy works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of recycled materials to sell. Levy has been in this business for 25 years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.en:
Maria Catalina works hard to support her family. She is a married parent of three children, two of whom are in school. She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Maria Catalina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Maria Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 47 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Maria Teresa has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino, 57 years old, is from the village of Massippi where agriculture is the main business of the community. Florentino is a very hardworking father; all he wants is to meet all the needs of his family. 

Florentino is asking a loan amounting Php 30,000 to buy additional farm inputs like fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business. 

He dreams that someday he can save enough money for his family to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and married with nine children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock of products to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, sugar, and eggs.

Maria has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice and pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, sugar, and eggs.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 58 years old and married with four children.  With  children in school, Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of recycled materials to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for nine years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell recycled materials

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 64 años de edad, estado civil conviviente sin hijos a su cargo tiene casa propia vive en el distrito de Oyotun provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque - Perú, la cual es una zona rural,en este distrito se dedican a la agricultura(arroz,maíz,caña), crianza y venta de animales de corral así como engorde de ganado estos productos los venden en el mercado de este distrito y en cayalti.

Carlos se dedica al comercio(crianza y venta de animales patos, gallinas entre otros); además tiene 5 cabezas de ganado los cuales vende ha compradores de cayalti para la venta de estos en diferentes zonas de chiclanero. El ha solicitado un préstamo a edpyme alternativa de 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales y poder vender en estas fechas patrias y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 64 years old, he is in a civil partnership, and he has no children and has his own house. He lives in the district of Oyotun in the province of Chiclayo and in the region of Lambayeque in Peru. This is a rural area where people work in agriculture (rice, maize, and sugar cane), farmyard animal husbandry and resale, as well as livestock fattening. These products are sold in the district’s market and in Cayalti. 

Carlos works in commerce (raising and selling livestock such as ducks, chickens, among others); he also has 5 cows which he sells to buyers from Cayalti who then resell them in the Chiclanero region. 

He is requesting a loan to Edpyme Alternativo for the amount of 2,000 Nuevos Soles to purchase livestock and sell the livestock during the national festivities and in that way obtain higher revenues for his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchasing of livestock to eventually resell.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador thanks all Kiva Lenders for helping him realize his long-terms goals. He has repaid his loan to Kiva lenders on time, and could save some money for the purchase of his own plots. He could also expanded his rice areas with the profits of this loan.

He approaches ASKI MFI and Kiva lenders for another loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the new season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the new season.

loans.name: Juvilinda

texts.en:
Juvilinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Juvilinda has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and widowed with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell gasoline business for 10 years, and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Emma is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy materials for fishing such as fish nets, bamboo, wood, etc for her fishing business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream ofsaving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing such as fish nets, bamboo and wood

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of used clothes to sell.

Janet has been in this business for three years. Janet earns more income from her buy and sell of rice business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old and married with two children who are in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling of personal collection products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of personal collection products.

Jocelyn has been in this business for four years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice and vegetable farming and raising goats. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in market for her vegetable vending business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
