Judy is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Judy is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase livestock to raise and feed.

Judy has been raising livestock for 10 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream if saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise and feed

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
$800 is offered to Paulina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as noodles, Fanta, bread, sugar and coffee.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2008. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Paulina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, Fanta, bread, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: Yola es soltera pero tiene 3 hijos  ella vive en la comunidad de Taypillanga en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Yola es agricultora y necesita un credito para compra de ganado vacuno para mejorar sus ingresos Yola es la unica que contribuye a la economia del hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Yola is single but she has 3 children.  She lives in the community of Taypillanga in an adobe house that she owns.  Yola is a farmer and needs a loan to buy dairy cows to increase her income.  Yola is the only one who contributes to her household's finances, and so this is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian is a rice grower in northern Isabela. At 42 years of age, he is a producer who is passionate about what he does. Julian, his wife, and their two children, work on their small farm in order to improve their living conditions. 

Julian learned how to farm from his father. Now he is passing on his knowledge to his children and teaching them the love of crop growing, so that their descendants can follow in their footsteps. 

In order to keep his crops well developed, Julian is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies that will help improve the nutrition for his plants. This is part of the maintenance regimen for his crops. As a result, he will continue achieving results that will positively impact his life and his community.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies that will help improve the nutrition for his plants.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson has a farming business, growing rice in his field. He is married and blessed with children. Nelson’s wife is a homemaker. They don’t have other sources of income aside from farming. He admits that sometimes he finds it difficult to send his children to school, but he is doing his best to provide for a better future for his children, as he believes that learning is something that no one can take away from them.

Regarding his farming business, Nelson is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm. He hopes that someday he will successfully finish sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, requiere un nuevo préstamo que utilizará para  comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra, para seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura y  la ganadería.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar su producción e ingresos, sus nuevas condiciones económicas le permiten cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Luis needs a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor so that he can continue to invest in his livestock and farming business.

His previous loan helped Luis to increase his production and income.  With his new financial resources, he was able to cover the basic needs of his family and pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor for his farm

loans.name: Zaidy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Zaidy works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Zaidy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish for her business.

Zaidy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando es casado y tiene 4 hijos Armando vive en la comunidad de Taypillanga en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Armando se gana la vida como agricultor y quiere un prestamo para comprar ganado, de esa manera podra producir más leche Armando no tiene otra fuente de ingresos por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Armando is married and has 4 children. Armando lives in the community of Taypillanga, in an adobe house that is own property. Armando earns his living as a farmer and wants a loan to purchase livestock, and in this way he will be able to produce more milk. Armando doesn't have any other source of income, for this reason he needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 59 years old and married with two school-aged children. 

He is a carpenter by profession, but he also does rice cultivation on land that he inherited from his father.  He uses the tractor for additional income during off seasons and in periods when he doesn’t need the tractor on his own land. His dream is to give both of his children a proper education and a good future. 

He is asking for a new loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is 40 years old and married, and she has three children. 

Her spouse is a carpenter while she sells food for meals and snacks as a source of income. Maryjane is sending her children to school and manages her income for meals and allowances at school. 

Her daughter Maria Florence is taking up Mass Communication. She wants to earn a degree but Maryjane has insufficient funds, which is why she is asking for PHP 7,000 to pay the tuition fees for her child. 

She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for her child

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is age 52, single, and has two children. She has sold assorted candies in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their food expenses and the school allowance of her one child who's still studying. Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase assorted candies to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase assorted candies to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before requesting this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from seaweed farming. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is 52 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, chips, noodles, spices, etc.

Benilda has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell such as canned goods, chips, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 51 años se dedica a la actividad comercial, en su oferta la ropa, el calzado y los perfumes son los principales productos que su clientela compra y generan ingresos para beneficiar el bienestar de su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos adultos. Maria tiene 10 años de experiencia empresarial y esto se lo debe a su amiga quien le recomendó dedicarse al comercio de mercancía variada para obtener ingresos. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito trabajando todos los días de la semana desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y para ello compra los productos en la modalidad de contado, a almacenes de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Sus metas consisten en incrementar sus ventas y finalmente abrir al público un local, para mas adelante remodelar su vivienda superando el gran desafío de fidelizar cada vez mas su clientela.   En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, cremas y perfumería, con esta inversión proyecta aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades mejorando así su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria has 10 years of business experience; she owes this to her friend who recommended that she should work in merchandise to obtain income. She performs sales on credit, working every day of the week, from 8 in the morning to 6 in the afternoon. She purchases the products in cash to warehouses in the City of Barranquilla. 

Her goals are to increase sales and to finally open a store to the public so that she can restore her house and to overcome the challenge of creating a loyal customer base. She is currently applying for a credikiva, her first financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this she will purchase clothing, footwear, creams and perfumes. This investment she expects to increase her sales and her utilities, thus improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Helen has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns an income from planting seaweeds. Helen aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alindor Hipólito

texts.es:
Alindor Hipolito tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Pucara, un pueblo de clima caluroso, tranquilo, en su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, esta comunidad está ubicada en la Provincia de de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios como zapatero, realizando esta actividad desde hace 10 años, no tiene ingreso adicional ya que con esta actividad le es suficiente para solventar sus gastos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales, cuero entre otros y de esta manera generar ingresos para obtener mayores ganancias y asi una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alindor Hipolito, 54 years old, lives in Pucara district, a town with a warm climate that is quiet and whose population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry.  This community is located in Jaen province, which is part of Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. 

He offers services as a shoemaker, and has done this activity for the past 10 years.  He doesn't have any additional income since this work is sufficient to pay his costs.  He has applied for a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase materials, leather among others, and in this way generate income to get increased profits and, in turn, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his business by purchasing materials, leather among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix up the furniture salesroom.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 60 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Isabelita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from seaweed farming. She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family. She has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase plastic bottles, wire, bamboo, etc. for her cultured seaweed business.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bottles, wire, bamboo, etc.for her cultured seaweed business.

loans.name: Angel Daniel

texts.es:
Ángel, solicita más capital para surtir el inventario de la tienda y la mini librería comprara bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, lapiceros, cuadernos, borradores y otros productos para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y mantener su fuente de ingresos funcionando.
El financiamiento anterior le ayudo a mejorar la variedad de mercadería, las ganancias son mejores, ha cancelado la deuda adquirida y su familia tiene mejores circunstancias de vida.
texts.en:
Ángel asks for more capital to stock the inventory of his general store and mini-bookstore.  He will purchase drinks, basic grains, snacks, pencil cases, notebooks, erasers, and other products to keep his customers satisfied and keep his source of income functioning.

The previous loan helped him to improve the variety of merchandise, the profits are better, he has paid off the debt he acquired, and his family has better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, basic grains, snacks, pencil cases, notebooks, erasers and other products to keep his customers satisfied.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raul  esta casado y tiene 8 hijos  Vive en la comunidad de Taypillanga  en unca casa de adobe junto a sus padres Raul es agricultor y necesita un credito para comprar ganado, de esa manera podra producir mas leche y mejorar sus ingresos, Raul es la unica persona que colabora en la economia familiar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Raul is married and has 8 children. He lives in the community of Taypilanga in an adobe house with his parents.  Raul is a farmer and needs the loan to purchase livestock, and in this way be able to produce more milk and increase his income. Raul is the only person who participates in the family economy, and for this reason, he needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina, 45 years old, is married with three children. Paulina is engaged in selling meat in the community. She is diligent person and very supporting mother. To have additional income, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP 30,000 to buy pigs for her meat business. Her father, who is also in the picture, helps her in selling meat.  In the future, Paulina hopes that she can meet all the needs of her family, so that they can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her meat business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose tiene 57 años de edad, vive en la provincia de Jaen un lugar de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios como transportista, realizando esta actividad desde hace 15 años, no tiene otra ocupación ya que la actividad que realiza demanda de todo su tiempo, y le acalza para los gastos que tiene mensualmente, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para gastos personales y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 57 years old, and lives in Jaen province, a place with a warm climate, whose population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, and which belongs to Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

He offers services as a hauler, doing this work for the past 15 years. He doesn't have any other occupation since this work that he does requires all of his time, and is enough to pay his monthly expenses. He has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative to personal expenses and, in turn, to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in personal expenses and, in turn, be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 49 years old and married with three children. She has been raising pigs for three years now and earns additional money from farming cashew nuts.

Rosemarie is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family.  She is a married parent of nine children, four of whom are in school.  She has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and a general store.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings and other materials for her cultured seaweed business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es: Astrid de 22 años de edad conforma su familia con una niña de 2 años. Para generar ingresos se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y de frutas tropicales, negocio que inició asociada a su tía desde hace varios años y solo hasta hace 1 año obtuvo su propia experiencia empresarial. En su negocio  ofrece hamburguesas, salchichapapas, perros calientes, que prepara con las mas deliciosas salsas y vende directamente a un consumidor final, conformado por su vecindad y los transeúntes de su barrio. Su actividad productiva la inicia desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 12 de la noche trabajando los sábados, domingos y festivos. Su meta es lograr el mejoramiento de su infraestructura , sillas, mesas, carpa, activos fijos para generar mas impacto visual y finalmente remodelar su vivienda , aunque su gran desafió sea el de fidelizar a su clientela y ahorrar. Astrid está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará víveres para incrementar su producción un enfriador para mejorar la refregeración y ofrecer refrescos mas frios en un clima cálido lo cual agradará a su clientela haciendo que su negocio mejore cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Astrid is 22 years old, and her family consists of herself and her 2 year-old daughter.  In order to generate income, she has a business selling fast food and tropical fruit.   She started this business along with her aunt a number of years ago, and she has been running the business for the last year.  In her business she offers hamburgers, sausages and French fries, and hot dogs that she prepares with the most delicious sauces.  She sells these items directly to the final customers, who are her neighbors and people passing through the neighborhood. 

Astrid carries out her productive activities starting at 6 in the evening until midnight, working Saturdays, Sundays, and festivals.  Her goal is to improve the infrastructure of her business with chairs, tables, a canopy, and fixed assets to generate a greater visual impact for her business, and she would also like to make some improvements to her home.  Her main challenges are to make her customers loyal to her business, and to save money.

Astrid is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she has taken with the Fundacion Santo Domingo.  She will use this loan to buy food items to increase her production and a refrigerator to improve her refrigeration.  This will allow her to offer more cold drinks in her hot climate, which will please her customers, making her business improve over time.

loans.use: to buy food items and a refrigerator

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 46 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with four children. She has been managing a retail store in their village for almost 12 years and earns a net income of PHP 7,000 weekly, money that is usually spent on school allowances for their children. 

Due to insufficient funds, Rosemarie would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase raw meat, dried fish, vegetables and frozen foods to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase raw meat, dried fish, vegetables and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Jemalyn

texts.en:
This is Jemalyn, a  37-year-old married woman from Cabagan. She is busy with her business, which sells a variety of decorations for home and office. 

Because her products are very much in demand, Jemalyn is requesting a loan to buy more products that she can display in the store. She hopes that she can meet the demand of her customers in order to save enough money for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products that she can display in her store

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Violeta has a business selling "chorizo" (processed meat) and dried fish in the community. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work.

Violeta has saved for the repair of her house but lacks funding. She has requested a loan to purchase housing materials.



Violeta has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Violeta would like to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married with one child. He is 46 years old and lives in P-3 Clarin, Philippines.

James sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 14,900 to restock his store with basic commodities.

James has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, James hopes to financially support his immediate family members.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 56 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is single without children.

Evangeline has a rice retailing business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for her cultured seaweed business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to pays for laborers' salaries for her cultured seaweed

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Maria works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell veterinary products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and vegetables. Maria is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her veterinary products business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for a variety store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, green beans, onions, chili peppers and other items to stock his inventory.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: Juanito is 44 years old, married and has four children. Out of his children, two are studying at the college level of education. Juanito admits that there are hardships in life, but he and his wife are doing their best just to send their children to school so they will have a formal education. Juanito’s source of income is farming. He grows corn in their field. Through his income, he provides his children tuition fees for school. He always wished to have a higher income and further support his children's education. With regards to his farming business, Juanito wanted to borrow a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy herbicides, fertilizer and pay for his labor cost in farming. Juanito considers the loan as a big help for him as support

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizer, and pay for his labor cost in farming.

loans.name: Anacris

texts.en: Through her retailing business, Anacris is able to earn profits that she uses to meet their daily needs. She is 33 years old and has three school age children. Anacris persevered in managing her sari-sari store business because she wanted to see her children soon as professionals. She will prioritize her earnings from the business to use for her children's education. Anacris wishes for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy grocery items such as biscuits, condiments, shampoo, detergent soap, and many more. She will manage the business well so that the financial support she obtains will not be for nothing.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as biscuits, condiments, shampoo, detergent soap, and many more.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 61 years old and lives in P-2 Clarin, Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

To earn a living, Manuela has a carinderia ("mini-restaurant") business selling viands in the community. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Manuela has requested a loan to buy needed ingredients and spices for her business.

Manuela has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Manuela would like to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to buy needed ingredients and spices for her business.

loans.name: Romelie Fe

texts.en:
Romelie Fe learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. She tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. 

She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Romelie Fe has borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost for this cropping season. Romelie Fe looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Flordelyn

texts.en: Flordelyn has requested a PHP 14,900 loan through PMPC to buy fertilizer for farming.  She has been in this business for eight years now. Flordelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns additional income from rice farming and poultry.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She has requested a new loan of  PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Remedios dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Miguel David

texts.es: Miguel de 42 años, desde hace 3 entendiendo que su esposa por tradición familiar le gustaba  tener negocio, decidió vender mercancía variada,  pues  cuando la conoció se encontraba desempleado y ella con su dinamismo lo impulsó. Hoy en su haber tiene para la venta ropa, calzado, mochilas, mantas traídas desde la Guajira  que ofrece en forma directa a su clientela vendiendo de contado y a crédito semanalmente y quincenalmente trabajando desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 12 del medio día y desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche. Sus principales clientes son las personas ubicadas en su vecindad y amigos que le referencian otros nuevos clientes. Su meta mas adelante es tener un almacén y finalmente comprar una casa para su esposa y para él, aunque su mayor desafio es generar ingresos suficientes, para cumplir con sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mochilas correa, mantas y sandalias, provenientes de los aborígenes de la península de la Guajira y que son muy solicitados por sus clientes, con lo cual aumentarán sus ventas mejorando su negocio.
texts.en: Miguel, 42 years old, 3 years ago, understanding that his wife by family tradition would like to have a business, decided to sell various merchandise, since when he met her, he was unemployed and she, with her dynamism, pushed him to do it.  Today, he sells clothing, footwear, shoulder bags, and ponchos brought from Guajira, that he offers directly to his customers, selling in cash and on credit weekly and biweekly, working from 9 in the morning until 12:00 mid-day and from 3:00 in the afternoon until 7:00 at night.  His primary customers are the people located in his area, and friends that others of his customers have referred.  His future goal is to have a shop and, finally, to buy a house for his wife and himself, although the great challenge is to have sufficient income to realize his dreams.  At the moment, he is applying for a Kiva loan he first loan that he has gotten from the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, by which he will purchase indigenous-style bags, ponchos and sandals, coming from the indigenous people on the Guajrira and that his customers ask for frequently, with which he will increase his sales, improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase woven, indigenous-style shoulder bags, and belts.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more seaweed seedlings to culture plants for her cultured seaweed business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings to culture plants

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Desde Enero del año 2013, una amiga de Luz le aconsejó comercializar mercancias variadas para ganar dineros generando así ingresos para beneficiar a su hogar. Eso mismo hizo y desde entonces no se ha detenido vendiendo Jeans, blusas, camisas, pantalones calzado, abanicos a crédito y de contado directamente a consumidores finales entre amigos y referidos por ellos . Para ofrecer un articulo competitivo, Luz compra en almacenes y distribuidores de la ciudad, para vender día a día trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Su meta es abrir al público un punto comercial y fidelizar su clientela y ahorrar, estos dos últimos son sus principales desafíos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Jeans, blusas, camisas, pantalones calzado, abanicos. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará porque incrementará sus ventas y sus utilidades .
texts.en:
In January 2013, a friend advised Luz to begin selling a variety of merchandise in order to generate income to benefit her household.  She began to do this, and since then she has not stopped.  She sells pants, jeans, blouses, shirts, footwear and handheld fans on credit directly to final consumers.  Among her customers are friends and others whom they have referred to her.

In order to offer competitive prices, Luz makes her purchases from warehouses and distributors in the city.  She works from 8 in the morning until 8 at night.  Her goals are to open a permanent location, to solidify her customer base, and to put money in the bank.  The latter two items are her main challenges.

She is currently seeking a Kiva loan, which is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.   She will use the proceeds in order to purchase pants, jeans, blouses, shirts, footwear and handheld fans. With this investment she will be able to increase her sales and her profits.

loans.use: to purchase pants, jeans, blouses, shirts, footwear and handheld fans.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Ivan es casado tiene dos hijosy vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde tiene un acuerdo de anticretico Ivan necesita un credito para aumentar el monto de su anticretico para oder quedarse en la casa que ocupa una temporada más La esposa de Ivan trabaja como cajera en un banco, aporta un ingreso adicional en la casa pero lo que ambos ganan no es suficiente por eso se necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Ivan is married, he has two children and he lives in La Paz in a brick and concrete house where he has a fixed payment loan agreement. Ivan needs a loan to increase the amount of his fixed payment loan agreement so that he can stay in the house that he currently inhabits for one more period. 

Ivan’s wife works as a cashier at a bank and she supplies an additional income source to the household but the amount that both of them generate in revenue is not enough, that is why they need your support.

loans.use: to increase the amount of his fixed payment loan agreement so that he can stay in the house he currently inhabits for one more period.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: Ariel  es soltero y no tiene hijos Vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento  que le pertenece a sus familiares Ariel es costurero y necesita un credito para comprar material como tela e hilo Ariel es la unica person que contribuye con la economia familiar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Ariel is a single man and does not have children.  He lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house that belongs to his relatives.  He is a tailor and needs a loan in order to purchase material such as thread and cloth.  He contributes to the family's income and they depend on his support.

loans.use: to purchase material such as thread and cloth.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with six children. She is 36 years old and lives in Mabini, Baliangao. Elizabeth is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to harvest more vegetable crops and become a supplier in the neighboring market.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 38 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for 11 years and also earns an income from cultured seaweed.

Victoria has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Virginia is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings and other materials for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and other materials for her business

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweeds culture business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from fishing. 

Estelita requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc. for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweeds culture business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Estela requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional plastic rope, seaweeds seedling, etc. for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic rope, seaweeds seedling, etc.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is a farmer and his wife is a daycare worker. Arnel grows two hectares of corn on their farm. He has managed it for almost 20 years. He shares that his only capital in the farming business was his experience, which became his expertise. However, expertise is not the only need in farming. It is not enough to grow his crops well. 

At this point, Arnel wants to borrow 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pay for labor costs. He will use his earnings from the farm for the education of his four children. He will always prioritize his children's need to finish their studies and have a better job someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Sanny

texts.en:
Sanny is happy living with his wife and his two children. His children go to school and are now at the elementary level. Sanny hopes that even though they belong to a poor family, he will be able to send his children to school until college. It would be a source of pride for him to help his children finish college and become professionals someday. Through farming, Sanny is able to finance his children's basic needs and their studies. He believes that education is the best treasure he can give to his children. 

Sanny needs to work hard and manage his farm well to get a better yield and earn a higher income. Because of this, he is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy herbicides and pay for labor for harvesting. Sanny hopes to build the business and to make his wish a reality.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and pay for labor for harvesting.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, is age 56, married, and blessed with eight children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 20 years, and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 daily. She also sells a hundred thousand pieces of banana to deliver to different provinces to sell so that she can earn more income. Her net income on this business is usually spent on the school allowances for their children. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase breads, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, beverages, sugar and 90,000 pieces of banana to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to expand and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase breads, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, beverages, sugar and 90,000 pieces of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Determination and hard work are what Daisy holds on to for her farming activities. She has made extra efforts to make farm sustainable. She is thankful that PMPC has stood by her for her needed capital. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase farm inputs and seedlings. She is hopeful that this will double her profits for the cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seedlings

loans.name: Jainy

texts.en: Jainy has skills in making snacks and she is happy to earn a living from snack vending. Determination coupled with hard work help Jainy earn an income of PHP 3,000 per month. She is thankful for PMPC for the financial help it extends. In need of additional capital to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending, she has applied for a loan to PMPC. Jainy has high hopes to sufficiently provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending.

loans.name: Aracely Miyerlandi

texts.es: Aracely  es madre soltera de 22 años, tiene una hija de 3 y un hijo de 6 años de edad, el niño está asistiendo a la escuela y a la niña la deja en el centro infantil mientras Aracely se va a trabajar al campo, ella es una joven colombiana que ya vive 4 años en Ecuador y que está a gusto en este país ya que le pagan justo por el trabajo que ella realiza, Aracely se dedica 2 años a la crianza de terneros, ella  va a invertir el crédito en la compra de terneros  para incrementar su negocio, Aracely  aspira que le vaya bien en su negocio y por medio de este  darles a sus hijo lo necesario para que asistan a la escuela.
texts.en:
Aracely is a 22-year-old single mother. She has a three-year-old daughter and a six-year-old son. The boy is going to school and the girl goes to daycare while Aracely goes to work in the fields. She is originally from Colombia, and has been living in Ecuador for the past four years. She is happy in this country because she gets paid fair wages for her work. 

For the past two years, Aracely has been working raising cattle. She will invest this loan in buying calves in order to increase business. Aracely wants her business to do well so that she can give her children what they need in order to go to school.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Grace is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to  buy fish nets and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Josie works hard to support her family.

She has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. Josie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of seaweed materials for her cultured seaweed business.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of seaweed materials for her business

loans.name: Nishana

texts.en:
Nishana is 39 years old and divorced with two kids. She is a very kind, joyful, hard-working, and goal-oriented woman. 

As the main source of income for her family, she grows crops and raises livestock. Nishana's  monthly income is 300 AZN from the sale of milk, dairy products, fruits, and vegetables. 

With the goal of developing her business further, she has turned to Aqroinvest for a loan of 600 AZN to buy mineral fertilizer to increase the size of her harvest. She plans to use the income from this increased business to further improve her household, as well as to build a barn for the animals.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is 50 years old and a married woman with three married children and two adolescents who are in school. She lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she and her husband manage a rice farming business, which is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been involved in this career for almost thirty years. In total, her family’s daily income is USD 8.00.

Van wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin lives in a hilly village.  He is married and they are blessed with four children, one of whom is going to school. Edwin manages two hectares of cornfields that he inherited from his parents.  Farming is his family's source of income and he earns a profit. They are able to meet their daily needs from their earnings in farming. Sometimes if they yield is low, they need to economize their budget. That’s why Edwin always wishes to have a good yield to be able to meet all his children’s needs. Applying enough farm inputs will have a tendency to have good yield. From this connection, Edwin is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farming business. He believes that by applying the exact amount of farm inputs, he will reap a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farming business.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 38 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nelita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old and married with five children, four of whom in school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Raquel is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase livestock to raise.

Raquel has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 26 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Remelyn has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 48 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation.

Luzviminda has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation

loans.name: Layheng

texts.en:
Layheng is 41 years old and a married woman with three children who are enrolled in high school. She lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a dessert seller in the market of her community whit the daily income is USD 3.50. Her husband, Chomroun, is a farmer who can make USD 4 a day. Totally, her family’s daily income is USD 7.50.

Layheng wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlina is engaged in the salon business. She does pedicures, manicures, and hair-cutting. She learned this type of business when she worked in someone’s beauty salon business. Her income from it serves for her children's allowances when they are studying. 

Now Merlita wants to have savings for any future emergency that may happen, so she will have money to use. At her age of 57, Merlita still doing home service for her customers. She is still enjoying her business; that’s why she is not getting tired of doing it. 

In the end, Merlita is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to buy supplies and kits for her beauty salon business. She hopes to encourage more customers to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies and kits for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Jemarie

texts.en: Jemarie lives in San Roque with her parents who are farmers. She is 18 years old and a second-year college student. Sometimes they lack financially because income in the farming business is not stable. But despite their financial situation, she stills pursues to finish her degree. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay tuition fees and allowances. This loan will help pay her tuition fees on time.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and allowances

loans.name: Zibeyda

texts.en: Zibeyda is 47 years old, has been married over 26 years, and has a child. Now she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren in Horadiz village in Fuzuli region. But for already 21 years the family members are IDP--Internally Displaced Persons--from Fuzuli city. Zibeyda rents a shop in the local bazaar and in there she sells cleaning products. Today Zibeyda is planning to increase her business. She needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy more products for selling. Zibeyda says great thanks to Kiva organization for the loan and help.

loans.use: to buy more products for selling

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy motorcycle spare parts and other materials for her motorcycle transport business.

Lorna has been in this business for 2 years. Lorna earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and other materials for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 62 years old and single with children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy sugar, milk, soft drinks, chips, etc. to sell.

Aurora has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years. She also earns an income from a buy and sell nipa roofing business and by raising chicken.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, soft drinks, chips, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Betty is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Betty has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is 49 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Felina is borrowing PHP 13,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Felina has been raising pigs for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gesabel

texts.en:
Gesabel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell for her buy and sell vegetables and spices business.

Gesabel has been in this business for 3 years. Gesabel earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old and has five children. Helen is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy goats to raise.

Helen has been in business for 4 years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen  would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy goats to raise.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna is 26 years old and married with three children who are in school. Johanna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Johanna has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Johanna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en: Nabila is a young women age 30, who lives in a small town of Lahore. She is married and has two children. She is a hardworking and dedicated mother looking after their house and children. Her husband is in a garments business.  She and her husband want to contribute more to their family income and provide a better standard of life to their family. Educating their children is their biggest priority. Given the growth in the sales of her husband’s garment business, her husband wants to purchase more stock to increase more profit margins. But as they do not have sufficient savings, she decided to apply for a loan. She requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva Partner, and is hopeful that this loan will help them increase their business.

loans.use: to buy garments for the growth of business.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan,  es casado, vive en casa propia con su esposa, sus tres hijos de 20, 16 y 4 años de edad; desde hace 20 años realiza el cultivo de maíz y pipián, es un oficio que aprendió en dentro de su familia, trabaja con la colaboración de sus hijos en un horario de 4:30 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y tiene muchos clientes a quienes les distribuye el producto.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, insecticidas, semilla, tubos, una bomba achicadora, etc., para tener el equipo necesario para realizar sus cultivos, con la inversión espera que su negocio tenga una cosecha abundante y mejoraren sus ingresos.
Sus proyectos son fortalecer su negocio para continuar teniendo ingresos y finalizar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan is married and lives in his own home with his wife and three children, 20, 16, and 4.  For twenty years, he has produced a crop of corn and squash.  He learned this work in his family.  He works in conjunction with his kids on a schedule from 4:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.  He now has a lot of experience and has many customers to whom he distributes his products.
He needs the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, pipes, a sump pump, etc. in order to have the equipment necessary to produce his crops.  With the investment, he hopes that his business will have an abundant harvest and improve his income.
His projects are to strengthen his business in order to continue having income and finish the construction of his dwelling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, pipes, a sump pump, etc. in order to have the equipment necessary to produce his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing the food that she sells in her cafeteria.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en: Reyhan is 45 years old. She is married and is living with her husband and son’s family. Her family members are internally displaced persons from Füzuli city over 21 years ago. Now they are living in Gorgan village of the Füzuli region. Her son was married and has two children. Reyhan has cows. She sells their milk and milk products (yogurt, cheese, etc). Now Reyhan wants to buy two cows to increase her business. Therefore, she needs 2000 AZN. Reyhan is greatly thankful for the loan from Kiva and she wants to build a big stall for cows in the future.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale. She is doing well with her husband in improving their main source of income. With her generated revenue, she had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. After she had joined GDMPC, her ability in improving lives was changed positively. To gain more harvest. she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites, age 44, is married to a farmer and they have four children. She has managed a hog raising business in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 5,000 for every two hogs. Her net income on this business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel runs a direct selling of cosmetics products and ready to wear clothes business. She has been eight years in this business. Maricel's husband is a teacher. She wants to help her husband even in a simple way. That’s why she engages herself in this type of business. Maricel has three children who are in between college and high school level of education. She needs to sell more items to be able to give their children daily allowances going to school. Maricel is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more stocks of lotion, fragrances, beauty products, shoes, and clothes to sell. Maricel hopes to maintain the business and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of lotion, fragrances, beauty products, shoes, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 51 years old and married with twelve children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marites has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from coconut farming. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Sarah has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Sarah would like to save money to purchase an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Marcia Magdalena

texts.es: A sus 22 años de edad Magdalena es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo de 3 años que asiste a un centro infantil, Magdalena paga arriendo en un cuartito  y vive ahí con su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años  a la crianza de chanchos y el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos en un pequeño lote que tiene su madre y ahí tiene sus animales, Magdalena también trabaja al jornal en el campo, comenta que ahí el trabajo en duro y que para almorzar debe llevar desde la mañana el avío (comida preparada que lleva desde la mañana para servirse  al medio día)  y que al momento de servirse ya esta frio pero que ella se sacrifica para tener ingresos para su hijo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio, Magdalena aspira que le siga yendo bien en la crianza de los chanchos para de estos ingresos dar la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
At 22 years old, Magdalena is a single mother of a three-year-old son who attends a childcare center.  Magdalena rents a small room that she lives in with her son.  For the past three years, she has worked raising pigs.  She will invest this loan in purchasing pigs to raise in the small lot that her mother has for her animals.  Magdalena also works as a day laborer on a farm.  She says that the work is hard there, and she must take her lunch with her in the morning, and by the time she has lunch, it is already cold.  However, she sacrifices to earn an income for her son.

She will invest the loan in purchasing pigs to improve her business.  Magdalena hopes that she will continue to do well raising her pigs so that she can educate her children with her earnings.

loans.use: purchase pigs.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun is a 54-year-old, married woman with four married children and three unmarried children. She lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. In the last thirty years, she and her husband have managed a rice farming business, which is the sole source of their income. Their farmland is located just behind the house and the net profit that this couple can make is USD 8.00 a day.

Sarun wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and to buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine and to buy its facilities.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Oliva has been working hard to manage her tailoring business where she sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Oliva has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for the tailoring business, and will help Oliva to generate greater profits and buy basic needs. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the tailoring business. 

Oliva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rabbits.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, es madre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales el primero tiene 24 años de edad y trabaja, el segundo tiene 20 años el cual estudia y trabaja, el tercero tiene 14 años y el cuarto tiene 10 años de edad los cuales solamente estudian.  Cecilia se encarga de costear los gastos de su hogar, ella genera ingresos elaborando la venta de pupusas, ya tiene 11 años de realizar dicha actividad, su hermana le enseño el oficio, atiende su negocio de tres de la tarde a ocho de la noche, su ventaja es que su producto gusta mucho a los clientes.
Con el capital comprara maíz, aderezos, aceite, quesillo, bebidas, chicharrón, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas, espera tener mayor productividad, tener un negocio más competitivo y mejores ganancias.
Cecilia anhela expandir su negocio, mejorar la alimentación, educación, vestuario y salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is the mother of four children of which the eldest is 24 and works, the second oldest is 20 and is in school and works, the third is 14 and is in school, and the youngest is 10 and also in school.  Cecilia is in charge of covering the household expenses.  She earns an income by making and selling pupusas.  She has been working in this business for 11 years.  Her sister taught her the business, which she works in from 3pm to 8pm.  Her advantage is that her customers really like her product.

With the loan, she will purchase corn, dressings, oil, cheese, beverages, pork rinds, etc. to make her pupusas.  She hopes to increase her productivity, have a more competitive business and improve her earnings.  Cecilia dreams of expanding her business, and improving her family's nutrition, education, apparel and health.

loans.use: purchase corn, dressings, oil, cheese, beverages, pork rinds, etc. to make her pupusas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies, pay for irrigation, and file paperwork to legalize the ownership of her land.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a hard-working woman who is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past seven months, Resty has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh fruits. 

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of sweet potatoes and bananas and will help Resty generate greater profits and stock more food. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand into a wholesale shop. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sweet potatoes and bananas
